wCwlwsCPWYe3wmO0AwbUSA.text: Manny welcome to the Boulevard! Manny said his tacos were good and he lied! They turned out to be great! We had the Lucas taco,Gobernador taco, taco de Camaron,and Manny's bomb ass Cameron enchilada!

photos.caption: Photo of Bajamar Seafood & Tacos - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Yawx9ns-bqBZU5Kvgh7-sw.text: This place is AMAZING and we go out of our way to stop for a meal any time we're in LV or passing through. First off, the owner and his partner (the chef) run the place and take great pride in their company. They're friendly and happy to serve their amazing and unique dishes. The Lucas Taco is my favorite, but the Pulpo Taco (octopus) is my husband's favorite! Their homemade cheesecake is also fantastic, we often take it to go! Everything about this place is authentic and the food is delicious. Save your time and money at those overrated restaurants in the casinos! Bajamar is IT!

5pjZGs5dLLFek2QPLIp5Vw.text: This is a fantastic place to get really good tacos and other Seafood filled dishes. A chick at Blackjack Collective recommended and boy am I glad she did! My sister and I tried this spot after class one day and we were pleasantly surprised by everything. The tacos were great, the surf and turf fries were great, and the service was great! I highly advise you to check out this location, everything was delicious.

NDCLAt0iLFFWPO8v3dq44w.text: We were looking for something not too expensive near our hotel and were absolutely impressed with the quality of the food. We got horchata which is served in a big mug and was amazing on a warm day. Then we had 2 fish and 2 octopus tacos and both were incredible as well as rice and beans on the side. Make sure you're ready for a little heat if you order the octopus taco! The total bill for 2 people was $22 which is a steal for the quality of food you receive here. Our server was very genuine and the whole experience makes me want to go back tomorrow.  I wish this restaurant was down the street from my house.

7v44JUDu2UrGJQiDcPF7mA.text: WOW! Amazing amazing ! Flew in from San Diego and this place was my first stop. Tried the Lucas taco & the Cameron Enchilado taco, so fresh and packed with lots of flavor. Not far from the strip and plenty of parking. 5 stars! A must try !

CQ7gnL1oKg0PG40E_2-L_A.text: Just found this little Jewel of a restaurant in Las Vegas. If you're looking for your typical Mexican refried beans enchiladas and rice you better go somewhere else. Because Manny and his chef put together some of the most interesting Baja Style Seafood Fusion tacos you will ever wrap your lips around. I ordered the first two tacos on the menu and they were amazing! When they asked if I was ready for the check I asked for the menu and ordered more tacos.! If you are real foodie you cannot leave Vegas without going to this place at least once. The quality and flavor of the food is top-notch. And Manny the owner makes it a pleasure to eat in his restaurant by making everyone feel special

4KdTEvWLdMBhvPYa0s0K1Q.text: Food was delicious.. service was great !! I had the fish taco special!! Good portion for your buck ... will recommend and will be back soon!

UAzEAnWMu1uLYzcLYvujbg.text: Great place!  Shrimp Tacos were amazing and good size for only $4 each.    The place is clean and new on the inside,  so don't let the area scare you.   Well worth it!

gtUqlj2Bf1Q6pjY1B0VktQ.text: Great food. Great atmosphere. Welcoming staff. Had the pulpo and Camaron Tacos. Would definitely come back. Perhaps more pricey than your average hole in the wall taco place, but it's not your average hole in the wall taco place.

0gYH5zqSuZwrNQ-dRH470A.text: So good... customer service was exceptional and the food taste great... 2-3 tacos were plenty and the lemonade is made from scratch and that was also really really good

qNisDrq0zi3DKvLbi0pynQ.text: This place is absolutely delicious. The service was amazing and the place is incredibly clean. This is a must do when visiting Las Vegas. I am very well versed in Mexican cuisine and I can say these are by far some of the best tacos I've ever had outside of Mexico.

A5PyLEkL2PUTNxdDIhgMJg.text: Best fish tacos in Vegas (octopus, marlin, tilapia). Killer horchata. Excellent version of Mexican cheesecake and the Hibiscus lemonade rocks!

L8Yviv9lIazuelPDjpFZVQ.text: Been everywhere on the West Coast to places that supposedly have the best tacos.....Bajamar blows away ALL of them!

5HuNSQPPx7Ue7VgMPavPyQ.text: Food is super fresh. This is right down the street from my boyfriends business and we loved the food! I had a shrimp cocktail, shrimp tacos and the surf and turf ( the only carne asada on the menu is on this appetizer only, fyi and the rest is fresh seafood). I promise you won't be disappointed

f3VPmK21qaRR_b3Arxhhaw.text: What a hidden gem! Unless you're a local and frequent Luv-It frozen custard, or was put on game word of mouth, chances of you coming to this place by chance are slim. Located on Las Vegas Blvd (The strip) heading towards Downtown, you'll find a quaint, brightly colored, turquoise building. As you enter, the bar is at the main entrance, to your left is the seating arrangement. The owner is there to greet you, super nice and approachable. He walks you through the menu, and explains each item. They are known for their seafood tacos! And let me tell you, they have exceeded my expectations! My fiance recommended that I try the Marlin taco a las brasas and I also wanted to try the fish ceviche tostada. The white fish for the tostada was unbelievably fresh! I am a huge hot sauce girl and this didn't need any extra kick or flavor, it was so delicious! My mouth literally waters talking about it. Great size to share as well. The Marlin was unlike any other taco I've ever had. The taco was crispy and the sauce had a tomato base sauce, fish was super fresh! A bit messy to eat but TOTALLY worth it! I will definitely be coming back! Well done, Bajamar!  Now open more locations! Preferably in the Southwest part of town

hkJbaK4x7XeQ1tzMK0GUxg.text: We make a bi-weekly trip for some fresh seafood, which is hard to find in the desert! Everything I've had has been fresh and delicious, and never leaves me feeling like crap. I've tried 2/3 aguachiles, a couple tostadas, mixed seafood cocktail, and most of the tacos - can't go wrong with anything on the menu! Also, Manny, the owner, is super accommodating and busts his ass. Our go-to taco place in town for sure.

K85N89f1sPJNgFsWPrnr_A.text: Amazing seafood. Great service.  The kind of place where you want to give them your money.    Super clean bathrooms.  Great find.

rR_3NVUGy-AISblcTFqxew.text: OMG Fantastic! From the Bajamar Aguachiles, fish tacos, and the octopus tacos are my favorite! So lucky to have found this place!

MF_pmjqRtr14FfhPUXaRIA.text: I try to only give five stars when they are deserved, and this place qualifies. Clean, friendly, fast and satisfying. Luv-it Custard next door. Free parking on top of it. Soon, I will regret writing a review and the five stars because this place will have long lines.

XWt669ikJWv7dnKD3U4sYQ.text: We dine here every other week.  The Bajarmar fish tacos are very good, not fishy and perfectly battered.  You can have it grilled but fried food is so much more fun.  What's even more fun is chasing it down with Negro Modelo Especiale on tap.  Appreciation to Manny and his partners for opening this restaurant.

0JMSR90WRFRquYNAoDzPCA.text: Wow this place was great! I ordered 3 different tacos to give them a try. My favorite was definitely the Lucas Taco!

nk4A6IqA2uMpu54iI_j77g.text: I'm a hardcore regular, my husband, baby and I come here at least 3 times a week.  The owner is SO nice and the the food is amazing. They serve the freshest fish you will find in Vegas. I crave the fish tacos and even the drinks are great. Tasty orchata with cinnamon on top and delectable Micheladas.   Good prices, good seafood, clean restaurant, friendly service - highly recommended!

zvTcmbbrvuU8XLQ6635aBg.text: This is a small taco joint.  I always enjoy new places close to Downtown Las Vegas.   The place is clean and nice considering the age of the building.  The food was excellent.   Had the shrimp tostada that was more of a shrimp cocktail on a tostada shell.  It was very taste but hard to eat.   The taco was better.   The fish tasted fresh and the taco had a great mix of flavors.   I would not consider this place super cheap (lunch can run $15), but for fish it is very reasonable.   I would definitely return.

n687AS6d5_zNBhObBIJSRg.text: Damn those pulpo tacos tho! I don't understand how people can eat tako at sushi joints when there is pulpo prepared the Mexican way! It's so tender and juicy and it reminds me of the skin and fat of buffalo wings (none of that pesky chicken meat) but octopus is actually very low in fat! How do they cook it like that?  My friend invited to for lunch, and she got two pulpo tacos and one fish. I got one pulpo, one fish, and one shrimp. I should have just gotten all three pulpo. The fish and shrimp was good, but not mind blowingly better than other places I've had. But the octopus! Not only have I not seen it on menus as a hot dish or taco, but it was also prepared so well, with a crispy, yet not hard shell tortilla, and fresh cabbage/tomato/chipotle cream. Everything about it was perfect.  The chef/owner? was extremely nice and remembered my friend. She spilled some sauce on her white pants and asked for some soda water to try to clean it up. He didn't have any, so he went to the Super Burrito place across the lot and got some for her there. What service!  The only thing is it's a little pricey, but it is in the normal part of downtown and not the ghetto. It's across from Viva Las Arepas. Parking is easy, and more parking in the back as well. The inside is very bright and clean. Doesn't look or feel like a dive, though I'm not at all against going to those places either. Def gonna be back!

3PU9a6cr0_KytIbN54q5IA.text: These guys serve really tasty tacos. The place is small and friendly. The food was freshly prepared and the restaurant is clean. They offer a good variety of meats and seafood options. I recommend this spot for some quick bites but parking can be tricky!

B-MBN1tx7YbaxsjkqbnfJA.text: If you don't like seafood, I feel bad for you son- you got 99 problems but Bajamar ain't gonna be one! There are tacos, tostadas, and more here, but they all come topped with creatures from the sea. This little gem is snuggled into a vagrant-friendly section of Las Vegas Blvd by the OG stripclub, but it's bright and colorful with friendly staff and fabulously fresh food.   Grab a trio of tacos or a couple of tostadas and share with a friend- or don't, I won't judge you. The namesake Bajamar fish taco is a solid and tasty go-to but if you like spicy, the pulpo (octopus) enchilado version is even better. The Marlin and Lucas tacos are also recommended, with the cocktails being best for groups. Belly up to the bar and ask Manny what's best!

3fBYTsJCehLwscXaqcfgHA.text: I live around the corner from this place and my neighbor kept telling me to try it. I should not have listened. I walked in and no one greeted me or said anything and when I asked to sit at a table I was refused because I was by myself. My tacos were completely out of the tortilla and looked like they were thrown together in haste. Oh and the waitress came by and took my fork before i was done :( . Safe to say worst service I ever experienced (and I've been to some pretty sketchy establishments) and small portions. You've been warned stay away!

I'll probably make this a new spot for Saturday lunch from now on. The service was great and attentive. If you like tacos at all, just go. you won't regret it. Plus you can save some room for desert and walk over to Luv-its for a cup of Custard. It's a fat kid's dream!

cpaxrTzIlEs7jGVlEOVtaw.text: Takes us back to the days when we used to run down to Baja Mexico for the tacos. The fish tacos and ceviche are spot on! The service is great as well. We are so happy our friends introduced us to this place.

VTBs4BX8Xawh4d_qQVHvhQ.text: Stopped in here for a quick bite and had a few amazing tacos and a great experience. The service was fantastic and this will now be a go to spot for me!

g2O0RvXkID1x8g7Gys4iaA.text: Best seafood tacos this side of the border. I've traveled to fishing villages through Mexico and never tasted anything as amazing as this place. This place gives Baja style seafood tacos a whole different meaning. The service is quick and the quality of their product is unsurpassed. The first few times I went the only disappointing thing was that they didn't sell beer, but now they have various ice cold beers on tap. All things in the menu are great but my 2 favorite items have to be the pulpo enchilado taco, and the marlin a las brasas taco. I guarantee that once you try it , you'll be hooked. I am anxiously awaiting the launch of their new menu since it will include the marlin al pastor taco that I had the privilege of tasting while they were testing it out. I can't wait.

nawbj-8q6ydcj-7IgrPkEg.text: The best fish taco place in town. Since we came for the first time last year this is our favorite place for quick bite before movie night. Great food and awesome service!

fP9CHwFTEapwsRlHYSroww.text: Currently writing this review from the restaurant were I just finish eating here. I couldn't wait to tell the world about this place. It's amazing!!! I got the pulpo tacos. (Octopus tacos) the pulpo was on point so tender. Wishing I lived closer to come here everyday. The owners are so sweet and on top of everything. Great customer service, and amazing food!

KY8Hi_Svh8pZEo_kL-AkFA.text: Better than el diamante and las islitas!!!  Its kind of small inside. But it feels like I am by the beach having a fresh taco

H-5aLL_QEDQkCXm2o1zRLQ.text: My boyfriend and I visited here for lunch before I had to go to work. With the recommendation from my coworker, I decided to stop in and see what he was "taco"ing about. :)  We both had a specialty drink, a shrimp tostada as well as two tacos each and we split the last one. For under I believe 30? Which is steal for the quality of food and detail they put out of that kitchen! Considering they are on LV blvd you should not complain about the prices. especially with how BIG the tacos are and the generous amount of fish given.  Manny is I believe the owner/general manager, but he was also our server! He was pleasant and always had a smile, and welcoming guests everytime they walked in. A couple who would be considered a "regular" who has visited the past couple of days while on vacation... walked in and he greeted them and seem to know what they were gonna order before they order it! How sweet! Manny and my boyfriend got to talking about various things, and how they started and where they are from. He is just an overall wonderful person to talk with. He even walked food over to there rival super burrito... EVEN THEY liked his food! :)   Boyfriend loved the authenticity of the horchata, the sauces, the fish batter, and the tostada. I loved it all. :)  I will be def coming back, and I will continue to tell people about this spot. They have only been open 4 months, and I hope they are there for the next forty years.   Come try them out, give a small business a chance to grow, they are hard working just trying to bring good food to vegas!

d8U72m2sGFqh6bC1T-KttA.text: I was in Las Vegas on a business trip and stumbled upon this great new taco place.  Upon entering, my first impression was how clean the restaurant is. We were immediately greeted by Manny, one of the owners who gave us a quick review of the menu. I chose to go with a grilled fish taco, grilled octopus taco, as well as a grilled shrimp taco. The food was prepared immediately and was outstanding. I highly recommend this location and look forward to returning here during my next business trip.

VXhLh-PemGHhzAwshHSKaw.text: RIDICULOUS TASTY FOOD!  Wow, the other Yelpers are much better at taking pics than I am, and truth: my fingers were messy after taking a bite of my marlin taco so I couldn't have snapped pics anyhow.  I tried the shrimp, marlin and pulpo taco (octopus). *It's kinda weird that tako means octopus in Japanese and I'm eating an octupus taco with tako as the protein.*  All three were out of sight, and I would most highly recommend the smoky and meaty marlin if you dine here.    The staff treated me like a friend and next time I'm in Vegas I'm hittin' it again.

nVpCw-3SpTafnoceOjSkBQ.text: Wow! This place is killing it on the taco front. My fave thing is the tortilla texture. It is not simply heated and filled. These tortillas are lightly fried and provide great chew and a little crunch. Not to mention the filling is abundant so you cannot roll this taco into your mouth.  Lucas taco was a great mash up of a shrimp chike relleno and a taco. Shrimp cooked perfectly, melts cheese inside the cooked pepper. Had to use a fork and I am not complaining! Surf n turf taco was a perfect marriage of their perfectly cooked shrimp and beef. Topped with guacamole but the fried onion crown was the cherry on top! A great departure from standard taco toppings. Had to try an octopus taco. I chose the Octopus Chicharron taco. I have never had octopus prepared this way and I am a fan! Texturally octopus is not my favorite but by deep frying the octopus it became a crunchy but still chewy marvel. This place makes me wish I had a Bajamar in my town! Until we meet again tacos of my dreams! Manny is super friendly, works hard and has this place humming! He makes it look easy. Food came out fast, hot and delish! Hope I get the chance to visit again and try more things on the menu. Hats off to chef!

p8hzd4FOxkT3t7_3l96OCg.text: Most amazing food ever.  Came here when we were in Vegas for EDC. This will be a place I go to everytime I'm in Vegas.   The service is amazing very friendly, attentive and helpful. You absolutley must get a michelada. I just about melted in my chair after the first sip it was delicious. I got the fish taco which was great and came with a good amount of fish. I also got a ceviche (cant remember the name) but it's the one with sesame oil. It was amazing. A different flavor profile then traditional ceviche but worth trying something new. Everyone I was with had nothing but good things to sat about what they ordered. You get a lot of food for the price.  Like I said this will be a go to for me whenever I'm in Vegas. Unless they would like to open one in Orange County. Then I'll be there 1-2 a week

Small but my kinda place hole in the wall I would say that's why I love this place you Eva come here get the surf n turf taco and the aquachiles Bajamar bomb.com everything is reasonably priced and good portions as well if you know me which I'm sure some of you don't I come from a seafood background my parents cooked seafood all my life so it's pretty hard to find a good spot other then home for seafood. FMxvW2QE31lPS7SIrTT6KQ.text: If tacos are a game, then we have a winner. The winner.  Bajamar Seafood & Tacos is one of the newest establishments to grace the corner of Las Vegas Blvd and Wyoming. This intersection has surprisingly been a destination hosting many foodstuffs over the year. It was the birthplace of the Goodwich, the first home of Desyree's gelato, and a brief incubator for Chef Justin Kingsley Hall (now of the Kitchen at Atomic). It's still home to the institution known as Luv-It Frozen Custard, although I may have started to visit it beyond those years.  And now we have Bajamar, the pinnacle of Mexican seafood tacos as far as I've witnessed. Maybe I haven't been to Mexico, but I've had a few delightful tacos in San Diego (as recently as eight days ago), both of which are the previous stops of the gentlemen who are running this place. Compared to those experiences they're doing everything better (aside from one killer smoked fish taco).  I happened to show up on Tuesday. This and Monday are when they offer the namesake Bajamar fish tacos ($3.50) for a dollar discount (down to $2.50, making them a steal). These are the best fish tacos I've had, with white fish battered and fried to crispy and tender perfection. These golden-brown morsels are layered along with salsa, red cabbage, and a delicious chipotle cream sauce inside an oiled and heated corn tortilla (the same single tortilla prep as in all of the other tacos which I enjoyed). A squeeze of lime is nice but not necessary. There isn't really any heat unless you wanna use the bottled hot sauces which the server provides you even if you don't ask.  You can get by on the fish tacos alone, but then you'd be missing out on other taco treats. The Pulpo Enchilado ($4) comes with chile de arbol, packing some heat but not that much (even for relatively heat-sensitive palates like mine), some Monterey cheese, and more of that salsa fresca and red cabbage. Amazingly tender octopus, which you might almost forget is present unless you get the pieces with the suction cups. I think it was in one of those food shows on TV where I heard that leaving those on adds texture, and now I see what they meant.  Last up for lunch was the Lucas taco ($5). I wanted to try their sauteed shrimp, and it was cooked to the right texture. Although it has the standard orange-ish and white appearance if you clean it off - suggesting that it's not that special on its own - you'll get so much flavor from the gooey Monterey cheese, the chipotle cream sauce, and the intact longitudinally cut (aka sliced lengthwise) half of a California pepper (aka Anaheim pepper). No regrets with trying this one either.  (UPDATE 4/16/18: The $4 Marlin taco a las Bresas is also quite something. It's the kinda fish flesh that cooks up to resemble terrestrial meat in all the best ways. But it's still pescatarian-friendly. The $4 Gobernador is another great shrimp taco.)  I'd also read that the horchata ($1.50) is a steal of a deal, and CM Taylor was right. This mason-jar version is rich but never seems too sweet. Get these if you like the cinnamon-y, creamy Mexican drink.   Bajamar left me with only one question in the end: do I clean only my fingers of the heavenly mess, or do I lick the plate too? Since there were other people around, I avoided the latter. Maybe next time I won't. And by next time, I mean next week.  Drive, don't run, to experience some of the best seafood tacos by far in town or anywhere else.  (P.S. Shout-out to beer buddy Justin, if you're reading this. You put this restaurant on my list.)

9gIB6lGY3gkgCxugQ2CpyA.text: Im a True Local Favorite Fan! They got me out of bed today with their post on Instagram, showcasing my favorite fish taco! And its 'Taco Tuesday' which means this delicious fish taco is only $2.50!  The 'Bajamar Fish Taco' has the perfect consistency and juiciness. The sauce is out of this world! I also tried the 'Gobernador' which is sauteed shrimp, with red cabbage, cilantro, monterey cheese, tomatoes and their special sauce. Its spectacular!  I always ask for my taco to be lightly crispy on the outside as it gives it the most amazing texture.  Im super full after one taco, but I always have to have one more.  My opinion, this is the best place for fresh seafood tacos in Las Vegas.. directly from Baja, Calif!  Get yourself downtown and grab a few, you will be happy you did, and hopefully will become a regular like me! And you can check out the welcome to downtown showgirl sign while you're at it!

1FmqcqeILzZ0z2atHRnTaQ.text: These guys knows how to make ceviche and tacos right! Fresh seafood and great atmosphere! You walk into a beach vibe playing raggae music and you instatly relax and unwind, the employees are great and upbeat and service is second to none! They make you feel right at home when you walk in, sort of like visiting your favorite uncle's house, clean establishment and very inviting, bathrooms are well taken care of. And the food!! To die for, try their octopus taco and marlin taco and you'll be hooked! Nice selection of beer as well. I don't think i have anything bad to say about this place but the fact that this place will for sure make you gain the extra weight, trust me its worth the extra calories!!

nsifaWBAx3t1nrFWZgbqSQ.text: Ah..the near religious experience of the perfect taco! And to add to the wonderfulness (is that a word?, well it fits) they specialize in seafood.    The place is small, but clean, open, and airy. The turnover is quick so there's not a wait even when they're busy. Our server/host/busboy was quick, efficient, friendly, and responsive.  We had the Bajamar shrimp tacos, the pulpo enchilado, and the Lucas taco. The shrimp taco had perfectly battered talapia, red cabbage, salsa fresca, and a wonderful cream salsa which all combined to make a tortilla envelope of goodness. The pulpo enchilado consists of sauteed octopus in a chili de arbol sauce, Monterrey cheese, salsa fresca, and a tasty and smooth chipotle cream sauce. The taco was incredible but the octopus kind of gets lost in everything, so I might have to sample this taco many many times to make up my mind. The Lucas taco is the specialty here and once you sample one you'll see why. Sauteed shrimp combined with grilled bell pepper, Monterrey cheese, and chipotle cream sauce make a scrumptious titanic taco. These are not huge tacos, pictures don't do them justice, but they are dense and tightly packed with amazing flavor and are highly satisfying.

9uzllDMSDdf2zhpG0nsURg.text: Amazing! Authentic, fresh, friendly and so clean (so fresh and so clean clean).Small town taco shop vibes, feels like you're on the beach. Right when we walked in we were greeted like VIPs. Menu is short and simple so you're not overwhelmed. Ordered the original fish taco, SO GOOD. And the shrimp tostada, so full of flavor until the very last bite. And I ate it ALL. Talked to the owner and he shared with us that they're straight out of San Diego. And they buy all their food locally and share it with the small businesses in the neighborhood! Not only are they delicious but they are making a difference in downtown LV. Will DEFINITELY be back!

jX34mKBQUuY6ui-cZU_iPA.text: Tradition when I leave Vegas calls to have a pair of tacos , I changed my mind this time for some seafood and it was a great choice . The crunchy beer batter is seasoned perfectly and the chipotle dressing compliments these tacos with a little squeeze of fresh lime that quickly transports back to my nostalgic childhood visiting Ensenada . I will definitely be back when I return , keep up the great work!

oxXUniAmB3je5Di243kFdA.text: We came here because of the 100 Plus 5 star Reviews and when the owner made recommendations we listened.  With so many Mexican restaurants to choose from here in Vegas, this one stood out.  It's clean, modern, friendly environment, and the owner is super helpful.   The food was appropriately sized, the flavors were delicious, and I wanted more after my 3 tacos.  Not because I was hungry but because it tasted so good.  The Lucas is extremely filling! 25Jx5D5DTgPGoip4vgesZw.text: This is literally a hidden gem. Love this place I went twice now cause I had to try different tacos and ceviches before writing a review and let me say hands down some very great tasting food . Fully recommended .

Kh_0t5cMp8ajXOh06x6rBA.text: As incredible as always. Since the first time we came here 9 months ago, quality has not gone down an even the slightest. We are here minimum once every 2 weeks, usually once a week, for our fix of tacos, aguachile, tostadas and everything else they offer.   Manny and team run a tight ship here. Service is 10/10, prices are fantastic for the amount of food you get and quality of food is, of course as good as it gets.   Looking forward to what the new year holds for Bajamar, but one thing is for sure...they are going to be as busy as ever !

KXN5GGMVbTOHbBN0Jytstw.text: This is definitely a hidden little gem of Vegas!  To start off, the place feels like home.  The service provided was very generous and polite, it's very rare to find service like this in Vegas. The waiter, which I believe was one of the owners; he was extremely attentive to our wants.. which we did order a bunch of food. He also provided a taste of background with the meal, which is a bonus. Overall the hospitality was outstanding.  The food was remarkably fresh and delicious! Also very affordable. From the handmade tortillas to the creamy sauce on the seafood tacos, the effort on plating was present and not forced. The combination of flavors were perfectly synchronized. There beverages are homemade as well. I can go on for a couple more paragraphs, but you definitely need to try this place if you have a taste for seafood! Or just love food!  Overall, it was overwhelmingly satisfying. I will definitely be coming back for some more!

hs0_MsSgnkZJx2rRnkOHTA.text: The best fish tacos I've ever had, bar none. I cant even begin to describe how much better they were than others. Get your ass here and help them grow!

PtWpOrUPMO0V0mOA-Zs9qg.text: WOW!  This little gem should be more on the radar of Las Vegas than it is.    I showed up on a Wednesday night around 5:45PM and the place was completely empty.  I sat at the bar (no liquor license quite yet for this place, so I opted for a bottle of water), was treated with warmth and kindness from the manager who clearly was grateful for my business and served up really fantastic tacos.   The taste of the two tacos I consumed were really fantastic and an explosion of flavors is something I will not soon forget.  The presentation was top notch and the quality was spectacular.  I am certain I would feel the same with whatever I consumed off their menu.    The establishment is not large and the parking is limited in the front, but opens up on the back (near Luv-It Frozen Custard).  I was advised a liquor license for beer and wine are on the horizon.  Go have drinks someplace else and do yourself a favor and go eat here!

Cofj-BGjk0Ai71ZD_8kLCA.text: Ohh my Gahhh what a great find! The Spicy shrimp, Octopus and Chile Relleno taco you must try. Those are my top 3, enough said!!!  This place came as a strong recommendation from an old friend so I knew I had to try it.   Cuisine: My Top 3 tacos are the Spicy shrimp, Octopus and Chile Relleno tacos. The spicy shrimp and Octopus being the top two. They each have a nice creamy sauce topped to them which I love. I've had the fish taco while it was good I wasn't crazy about it since the fish was deep fried but maybe that's for you. Now as far as a drink you MUST have the Hibiscus lemonade, the dark one. It is wonderfully tart and a nice addition to the tacos. I can't get enough of this drink and I guarantee you'll love it.  Customer service: It seems the same man is always working there every time I go and I certainly have nothing to complain about as he is attentive and friendly as well as his knowledge of the menu he can recommend anything to you that you may be in the mood for.  Location: Located in a very small parking lot which probably holds about five or six cars facing Las Vegas Blvd near Lovett's custard.  Ambiance: I really can't complain, they keep the place clean and have good music. Also plenty of paper towels at your disposal at the table!

pQgmfSXbaaTlYBcR1PeytQ.text: We were just looking for a quick bite to eat while site seeing. This is a nice little spot right on Las Vegas Blvd. Very clean inside..  Service was great and timely. The food was amazing! Definitely have to return.

i5nsdp9WCz2GF86VNpcD9A.text: Bajamar has the best fish tacos! You cannot get tacos like that even in California. We had the shrimp tacos and the marlin tacos, both flavorful and delicious. The only thing that would make it better, is beer! We will be back.

ouDoDAA1eDdc33Xu7rO1_A.text: Wow, just had their "surf n turf" under the specialities selection and a battered fish taco. Incredibly delicious and FRESH. MQpvj3Wlp22TtDn1Pc74IQ.text: Holly jumping peanuts - this place is freaking AMAZING. I haven't had fish this good in years. The place feels like one of those great little stands you walk into off the beach in Baja.   Lets start with the fish taco - the staple of any good joint in Baja - it came perfectly stacked and tasted amazing - fresh as can be - no oil flavor, just crunchy fish on a bed of cabbage with a slice of avocado and two amazing sauces slathered on top of a perfect size corn tortilla. And Mondays and Tuesdays they are a dollar off - at $2.50 they are a steal.   The cocktail was amazing and fresh. With octopus and shrimp a plenty. The best thing though was the AGUACHILE VERDE - oh my god - soooooo bomb.   Please check these guys out if you get a chance and love seafood.

Skk7j1UZl1b7JlHpOyT-4g.text: We were blown away by the food and the service.  You don't know what to think when you pull up but the amazing food and dedicated staff make it a must-visit! cUk04wmV_atP7NIGDW5JPw.text: This place was amazinggg!!! It was coincidentally close to  the hotel we are staying at and we didn't even notice this place until I found it on yelp. The decor inside is nice, the tables and chairs are well maintained. But the food! My cousin just arrived from Michoacan Mexico and she loved them. The tortillas are good, the shrimp, octopus, and carne asada have great flavors. Their house sauce is delicious! The tacos are a bit pricey but they're a big size and if you find them as good as we did then the price doesn't even matter. yxHq6nbtgvuwAakTb4GKNQ.text: Thanks to previous reviews I came to try their tacos and must say they were deliciousssss. I had the Governador tacos and my husband the Surf n Turf. You should try this place if you want good seafood tacos.

xwMPuL9Os5AjiakdHYPGvg.text: Mexican food is usually not my first choice for dinner. However, fish taco in this 110 degree Las Vegas summer day sounded extremely appealing. huetsXqNAsPA1FxWu4hMYw.text: Bajamar was further down the strip and I highly recommend this place. I had the shrimp and squid tacos. The shrimp tasted better but it was altogether very satisfying. The tacos are big and very delicious. The waiters were very friendly and attentive. I got lost in a conversation with an old friend from canada and they left us alone as we caught up on life and we didn't feel rushed at all. The tacos are also reasonably priced.

vh388t3HF85-nhGWu_YWqA.text: Once a month my coworkers and I head to this spot after doing some work tasks & I have gone about 6 times. Each time, I have NEVER been disappointed. Not in the food or service. I actually just brought my boyfriend here so he could try it out and he loved it as well!  I always get the green aguachile which is pretty spicy, if you don't like spicy food, STAY AWAY from both of the aguachile dishes they offer. I enjoy it so much, I could literally drink the juice from the dish.  I've also tried the Spicy Octopus taco & it was good but not as good as the Octopus Chicharron Taco. Their quesadilla is simple but really good as well because they serve it with some type of ranch sauce. The Surf N Turf fries (like carne asada fries but with shrimp and carne asada) are amazing! It's a very large portion so it's totally worth the money. The carne asada and shrimp aren't dried out unlike other places that serve carne asada.  They serve the BEST Michelada I have ever had. Love the amount of Tajin they add on the rim of the glass. It's amazing ! Their prices are very reasonable and I will continue to indulge in their yummy food! I really hope they expand because it is a little small inside although, if staying small ensures freshness, then I'll take it! Everything is made to order and I suggest you try this spot out whenever you have time!

I really would not recommend coming here, if someone does not enjoy fish or shrimp.   I ordered the carne asada taco, and it was not enjoyable. The meat was tough and lacked flavor. The tortilla tasted stale. It wasn't hard, and it wasn't soft.   With incredible arepas right across the street, I could not imagine coming back.   With that said, my fish-eating companions loved it. You can be the seafood judge.

Sc39W2lk6V2XiN4ATKBfiw.text: Four stars, only knocking off a star due to the tight parking and tight quarters inside. And I already feel guilty.  I know, I know it's crummy to punish a place for its success and the only reason parking and seating would be tight is because a place is successful and the only way a place is successful these days is if they are legit freakin' awesome!   Bajamar definitely is Awesome and then some. Very clean place - even the bathrooms, very fresh ingredients which is huge to me but even more so when we ware talking about fish.  Most incredible spicy Pulpo taco I've ever had and I've been all over both coasts of Mexico, so I feel qualified to be all judgey pants of the spicy octopus.  Can't really go wrong here, if shrimp is your thing then go for the Gobernador  or Lucas Taco but you'll only need two unless you're starving.  Just wish I was in this part of town more often so it would be easier to visit.

cS_KBBSZZQNRc4OHfUUJ6g.text: This is my favorite restaurant in the city.   Every dish cooked or raw is super fresh & tates super delicious.     The fish tacos are fried to golden perfection.   Perfectly seasoned.  I love all the veg & the Pico de Gallo on top.    Ask for the house made hot sauce, it's to live for.     Manny is a great human, owner & creator of baja mar, which is family owned and operated.       I love supporting this place & will vote with my dollars here happily, weekly to biweekly.    I love the vibe, tastes, sounds colors, location & price point.  Don't double think of you should vome here, just go.     There's one vegan option, well made & worth having. 9je_gN8J-YoRzcd5rZzaQg.text: It was just happenstance that we decided to drop in here because at first we were actually going to another place across the street that didn't look too clean :/ Then we looked over and saw this cool little place. I wasn't sure how it'd be but I'm sure glad we found this gem!   We ordered the Bajamar, the Marlin, the Lucas, and the Pulpo Enchilado tacos. My favorites were definitely the last two :) We also ordered the Mixed seafood soup since it was cold out. I can honestly say that this is the best Mexican seafood taco place I've been to in Vegas! I could probably eat those tacos all day!! Yummo for real! The soup was also very good; my spoon was literally loaded with seafood in each bite. They definitely don't skimp out on the portions and the prices are definitely reasonable. The micheladas are pretty tasty as well.  Aside from the food, the atmosphere is cool and the service provided by Manny is stellar! This is the real deal, Mexican mariscos...the owners, chef, and staff are from Tijuana so it's definitely authentic. They also order smaller shipments from Cali so the seafood tastes very fresh and doesn't sit in the freezer for too long. Can't wait to go back, especially when it starts warming up!

I didn't have a huge appetite when I stopped by a few days ago; therefore after a short debate I ordered one Baja Fish Taco $2.50 (perhaps a special) one Lucas Shrimp Taco $5.00 and a Side order of rice and beans $2.00 each. 5smUadN1XEGloSTDQcnfCA.text: Dare I say it...the best fish tacos in Vegas! Yes, I know, Vegas isn't exactly a fish taco destination, but still! These tacos are on point!  My love and I first came in needing a quick bite to eat in the area. Bajamar had been referred to me by a couple different people at this point, and I knew there were a few items I wanted to try. Needless to say, they did not disappoint. You know it's good when on your first visit, you're already thinking of coming back and bringing other people that will enjoy the experience as well.  After two visits now, we've had the opportunity to try the Raw Shrimp Ceviche Tostada, Mixed Seafood Soup, as well as ALL of the fish and seafood tacos, which include: Pulpo Enchilado Taco Marlin Taco a Las Brasas Bajamar Fish Taco Camaron Enchilado Taco Gobernador Taco Carne Asada Taco Lucas Taco  The seafood soup was certainly good, but I think I'd stick to tacos as my main meal. What did stand out was the Pulpo Enchilado Taco, where wonderfully tender octopus finds a rightful home. The tacos tend to be dressed in a few similar fashions. A closer look reveals that there are 4 shrimp options, one octopus, one battered fish, and one grilled fish option. They are all really good, and there isn't one I'd shy away from ordering. I'm interested in trying some of the appetizers as well next time to see how far the excellence extends. If a cool lager is not your idea of a perfect taco pairing then you could explore one of the Aqua Frescas they offer: Hibiscus Lemonade and Horchata.  It's as if the whole building was plucked up from Baja California and transplanted right here in Vegas, with bright colors and aesthetics that take you ocean-side right away. Inside you'll find a bar with a few beers on tap. Sitting here allows you to engage with Manny, a proud and friendly owner. There are also a handful of tables and a few high-tops in the long, skinny space. A code to get in the bathroom reminds you of your actual setting in Vegas, but also ensures a much cleaner facility to use while at Bajamar.  Return visits will certainly happen for us...we even have some more friends in mind that need to experience Bajamar Seafood & Tacos.

P_skfdxL1ofusc-7sQ8GMQ.text: Do you dream about swimming in the ocean and eating all those tasty fish around you like me? If you do...or if you're ready to begin, then this is the place for you, with Baja-Mexican flavor at a great price!  When you walk in, you are greeted by the welcoming smile of Manny, the owner. You can sit at the bar or at one of the tables and begin to peruse the delicious menu. The menu is straight forward, one side is in English, and the other in Spanish. On it you will find several Baja-style seafood options, including some amazing seafood tacos!  When my love first brought me here, we knew right away we would be coming back. All-in-all, we have ordered:  - Pulpo Enchilado Taco - Shrimp (raw) Tostada - Marlin Taco a Las Brasas - Seafood Soup - Bajamar Fish Taco - Camaron Enchilado Taco - Gobernador Taco - Carne Asada Taco  My favorite was the Pulpo Enchilado Taco but everything was made fresh and tasty. Chef makes a "Chipotle Mayo Sauce" that is spread on top of several of the tacos. If your friend is not in the mood for seafood?...not a problem. Chef can make Carne Asada Tacos as well. They are not on the menu, but Bajamar Seafood & Tacos will accommodate the request.   Their Tacos are not small, street tacos. They are big enough to just have two for lunch, but you'll probably want to have a third, just because it's that good. They have a few beers on tap, and offer a couple of Mexican drinks, like Hibiscus Lemonade Aqua Frescas, to quench your thirst...so refreshing!    Make a point to try Bajamar...who knows...we might even see you there.  -2018 review #9-

dk9ANym148P9Us3vp474pQ.text: If you want the yummiest fresh California style tacos this your place! This is my favorite taco joint in Vegas. They have the best quality food and ingredients for so cheap! Its such a great gem for Las Vegas.

5lqMaO3RgTltIUxsASvKig.text: I wanted to give it 4 stars. I mean, how many 5 star reviews can a place have? All those 5-stars make me highly suspicious, especially after reading an article about fake reviews recently. It can't really be all 5 stars, right?!  Well....   It's 5 stars. It's 5 stars of delicious awesomeness.  We arrived at 5 pm on a Friday based on Yelp reviews. There were only two other people eating and I wondered if Yelp had failed us.   Manny, the owner, has a knack for creating tasty masterpieces and excellent customer service.   I asked for a recommendation and quickly ordered his first suggestion, the pulpo taco and a horchata. My friend, who is less familiar with seafood tacos, decided on  the fish. As we hesitated with our second choices, Manny suggested he put in the order and then order more if we want.   He was very accommodating, even when my friend ambiguously declared she didn't like "something" on her first taco. He made her next taco with no crema, but then obligingly gave her two sides of it to try. She then fell in love with the chipotle crema and he won her over.  Overall, a great experience. I'd love to  try the rest of the menu. A few recipes may need some tweaking, but they clearly know what they're doing when it comes to cooking the seafood. Since I'm just passing through town, I'd love to see their clientele grow so it's here when I return!  THE FOOD  Lucas Taco (shrimp and california chile) Absolute favorite for both of us! Think Chile Rellano with perfectly flavored shrimp. My biggest disappointment was that it fell apart and I was forced to eat it with a fork.   Pulpo (octopus) The meat was tender and not tough. I've rarely had such well-cooked octopus in the US. Delicious, but be warned - the tortilla is lightly grilled in a LOT of oil / butter. It was dripping.  Gobernador Taco (shrimp and cheese) More of the perfect shrimp! With cheese!  Bajamar Fish Taco  Sadly, this was the least favorite for both of us. The batter on the fish was a bit soggy, but I suspect that wasn't the norm. Even assuming it's usually better, it would still be just above mediocre.   Horchata This might have been an amazing 5-star horchata, but I was so busy with my tacos I hardly paid attention. Overall, a very solid, classic recipe - well balanced sweet, cinnamon, and creamy.

zcdcV8n61zvmG9UY26-f8g.text: Amazingly good fish and shrimp tacos for not a lot of dinero. Treat yourself to the gobernador which has sauteed shrimp and Monterey cheese. Heavenly. The owner is nice and works hard to make the guests have what they need. I can't wait to come back here.

Very fresh ingredients, with a nice contrast between the cabbage, fish (or shrimp), and sauces.  I'm intrigued by the octopus taco, so I'll branch out the next time I visit.

nrqxtsn3gYO0_IZGW7hhBw.text: I HAVE NEVER HAD ANYTHING LIKE THIS BEFORE. I hope that first sentence will show that this place is good. The BF tried the bajamar taco and spicy squid. I went with the Cabo tostada, a cold, spicy ceviche that was packed with so much lime I wanted to lick the plate like a crazed maniac. The spice is heavy though so be prepared. My eyes watered the whole time, and it was glorious. If the owner added a different dessert that was as authentic as the food, I promise I would be here EVERY.SINGLE.WEEK. I'm sure the cheesecake is good too, but it just didn't match the menu IMO. I'm on standby!

94wigYONmbg7I51Fm9b_aQ.text: If I could give more stars I would....  The tacos are so delicious. Not soggy or too soft tortillas- they have a little crunch. The pico and creama is so fresh and flavorful. I recommended the shrimp as well as Lucas tacos. Adorable little spot, clean, friendly staff. Highly recommend!!!

zDvwVMOtlL6OQ_7IXs-9QQ.text: Stopped in on a Friday night right before closing (kind of surprised they close at 9!). We quickly ordered our tacos, I got the pulpo enchilado and the Lucas taco. The pulpo was great, I loved the texture of the octopus and the flavor is mild and doesn't take away from everything else happening in the taco. By comparison I didn't like the taste of the shrimp in the Lucas taco as much. I probably could have eaten that taco without the shrimp and been just fine. It has a giant pepper stuffed with cheese inside which is awesome but also super messy. The tortilla for this one is soft and gets soggy quick. The pulpo came in a hard shell which was much easier to handle. They did serve the tacos with an entire roll of paper towel which was fitting and much needed. Overall I did really like the tacos and experience. I'm going to have to come back when I don't feel as rushed and try more of the menu!

ffwd9NSmV52xKE2DWpSWew.text: Everything was delicious. We got the spicy shrimp tacos, spicy octopus tacos, Lucas taco and surf and turf fries. It was all super fresh and amazing. The octopus was succulent and seasoned perfectly and not chewy. Fast and nice service we were in and out easily. Will definitely remember this place when we're back in Vegas

l2Q2DLSCZ3pPO9Ckp2wBnQ.text: no joke, some of the best seafood tacos/food you'll have out there. at first I was slightly skeptical, man these prices are a bit higher than other taco joints. however, after trying out this tasty food I think that you more than get your moneys worth. those tacos are pretty hefty and filled with extremely delicious ingredients. everything is made to order so you can even customize it a bit to meet your needs. not many places do octopus tacos, but these guys do it, and they do it so you're eating something so good, you'll be thinking about it long after. seriously, if you like seafood, this place is a must try

MIv9zzWI3nfnDeiCdN6c9g.text: DOWNTOWN WINS AGAIN.   I frequent many restaurants in downtown Las Vegas and I am glad to add Bajamar to the list. I ordered the fish tacos thinking for a seafood taco spot this should be a strong item to start with and I was not wrong. The fish was well battered and the taco was texturally well balanced. I also ordered the Hibiscus Lemonade and it the type of drink you want to order every time you visit. To top it off Bajamar has a friendly staff and enough seating options to bring a large group of friends if needed. Thankful for the experience.

E03nOBS9PjKcvxGfjPvBsQ.text: Was very pleasantly surprised at how delicious this food is!  The wipe out tostadas was the best. Pared with Michalada can't go wrong.  Small place so may have to wait to sit in prime eating hours but worth it!  Would give 5 stars but the service could have been friendlier. ...although won't take personally since place was packed and they were busy. Will definitely be back.

They have the best octopus tacos in town. The shrimp and fish tacos are just as amazing. Each taco has is own flavors. Amazing!

0bLWQZMnCNEONSWPKvXEqQ.text: The best fish taco I have ever eaten. The staff was friendly & efficient. Highly recommended.

9PUPo2B28cnE_9N96WPzzw.text: Bro.....and girls. This place is a hidden gem. The tacos are really fresh and the ingredients are quality. The prices are so low i felt almost guilty, the service is awesome and home like AND the best Horchata i've ever had. I'll be back when i'm in close by. Thanks guys.

z-aPp7ApNPtRQ9TaUzP4oQ.text: Came here for a quick stop cheap eat because of the straight 5-star reviews, and now I gotta chip in another one. Honestly would give this place 10 out of 5 stars. Great food, great service, fast and efficient. The waiter (maybe owner?) is kind, friendly and honest about his recommendations.  So cheap yet so good. Atmosphere is done very well too. Clean bathrooms. As a designer I'm really impressed by how well done this place is for a low budget location. Definitely worth the walk from Stratosphere.  For drinks, we ordered the Horchata and Hibiscus Lemonade, both drinks which are made here in the restaurant. 100% would recommend. For food, we got the fish taco, octopus taco, battered shrimp taco and the appetiser that was second from the top on the menu (forgot the name). 100% would recommend the tacos. The potato fries dish was tasty, but a little too heavy for me because of the cheese and sour cream.

lJ7Kzy_9qKy5MeIiuUmmkA.text: Great recipes!!! Shrimp cucarachas off the hook. I've had a couple different seafood tacos and they're all REALLY good. Pulpo tostadas bomb. The fish ceviche was okay, needed a little bit of doctoring up for me, but that's practically everywhere(for me)just add lime and the chile. Restaurant and restrooms are very clean. Food is fresh and doesn't have that fishy smell. I thought the prices were on par with seafood. I been eating seafood for a very long time and it ain't never cheap (Mexican seafood or any) not even in the hood. Employee or owner maybe?seem to really care about service also, another plus. Guacamaya hot sauce. Will eventually go back for more

Ed8TMXEyLQqvMQcsRN-2sw.text: I've had this place bookmarked for a while now but we are rarely in this part of town, and I'm so glad we found our way here today. -5wCINaQZZZOertjl2aFjg.text: Food was delicious we order aguachile and shrimp tacos , we loved it .. and their horchata is fresh made ( amazing ) ... will definitely be back soon .. I recommend this place 100% !! You won't be disappointed..

rvf2n5Ghx8R6Y1cXTfhGfg.text: Is a must try if you come to Vegas!! We had tons of fresh seafood. We tried Octopus chicharrones(fried). We also tried Raw shrimp and a Marlin Taco.  Great service and flavors are unique to Bajas area.

_hmNSIB5dCkvFus3yu1iEg.text: So as a born and raised San Diegan, I must say this is the BEST mariscos I've ever had in Vegas. I'm a huge fan of seafood and this place superbly killed my expectations. Aguachiles is one of my favorite things to eat and I have a go-to spot in SD, but if I had to choose between my spot and this place, I'd choose Bajamar. The aguachiles are so good you don't even need to add anything to it! I would've been down to try every taco on the menu, but I was too hungover to. If you ever want a good meal, good ambience, and a taste of what authentic Mexican seafood really is this place is it!

sjrvHkKpHQhIz8zE2hpwUA.text: I tried almost all of the tacos on the menu and a tostada and everything was INCREDIBLE! The pulpo enchilado was my favorite. The service was very quick and very good. If you like seafood, you will LOVE this place! If you're in Vegas I highly recommend trying it out.

gS6v5YgsesR1Q1TMguxGLg.text: Just finished lunch here. EXTRAORDINARY. the food was amazing and the prices were far more than reasonable. Thx Manny

09-wLRqqXQY8c8schRhwTw.text: Cute little place the owner was so nice. We got our food to go. My 11 year old said his Octopus taco was delicious. My husband is in love with the ceviche. The beans and rice where very tasty. This is our new favorite Mexican restaurant

pOIrhXVfwqCvIbXkhQGgbw.text: This place was excellent!  The server started by giving us a sample of Horchata (a drink that tastes just like rice pudding) yum!  He also gave us a sample of a sweet drink made with hibiscus flowers. My husband and I had tilapia fish taco and octopus taco with rice and refried beans. We also had a quesadilla. Everything was wonderful!  I am a very picky eater and loved everything. We will definitely be back. The location is just off the strip and easy to get to. It is near the Stratosphere.

6bbxhw6tQilav2NowaPUXA.text: Best fish tacos I've ever had. This place needs to market more to the people who work downtown, usually they don't go down to Oakey and LVBLVD to eat. I tell all my friends about this place though. The staff is super nice

QpLLY7en7XrCQktfq31uuA.text: I lived in Vegas before and had never been here for whatever reason!! I visited this weekend and wow! The food is delicious. The staff was super friendly and service was great. I've never ate seafood in the US that taste the way it does in Mexico. Well this is the first place to give me that flavor!!! Love it!!

PoNyhCtp9aWruVb6kZuoMQ.text: This place is as authentic as it can get! The food is amazingly fresh and delightfully tasty. I can honestly say I've never not liked something I ordered from there. Definitely recommend the spicy shrimp taco! The staff is very helpful and always have a great attitude.

f10R-fPBEsn1p05IiB5yAQ.text: Was super excited to try this place out cause we've heard good things. Maybe we ordered the wrong items but we weren't too happy with what we got.   Service was ok. Nothing great, nothing bad.  I ordered a Baja fish taco  and so did wifey, a carne asada taco and we shared a shrimp with beets dish.  Son got the chicken fingers/fries.   Baja tacos- mine, the fish was dry and didn't have much flavor but they were a decent size. My wife's taco was cold.  Not really great for $4.50  Carne asada taco- it was good size with a good amount of guac on it but it didn't have much of anything else going for it. No salsa, no onions, no cilantro.  Asked for salsa or something to give it some more spice and they brought over some vinegary thing that wasn't spicy. Just tasted like vinegar/water.  $5 taco  The shrimp dish was raw shrimp and there was plenty of them. They hadn't sat in the marinade long enough to "cook" like you do with ceviche, so it was literally raw shrimp. Maybe that's how it's done and not let to cook but wasn't our thing. It had good flavor and boy was it Spicy!!! Like numb my mouth eye crying spicy. Wife couldn't handle it and I was just glad I had my horchata. It was a unique dish but wouldn't order it again. I think it made wife and I sick from the raw shrimp. $twenty something.   Chicken fingers. Two really thin strips of chicken tenders with some cold fries.  The tenders did look house made so that's a plus but it was two tiny little tenders. For $5!  The batter was almost as thick as the chicken was. Lol.    We got two horchatas, one for me and one for my kid. She asked if we wanted a kids size which we did. Son got it in the little small plastic cups that kids drinks come in which was cool but when we ask for a refill there wasn't any.  We paid the same for a regular cup and the kids size! Not a big deal if we would have known we would have just had them put his drink in a regular cup that's twice the size for the same price.     Overall not the best experience and the food didn't make up for it either.

Fz4jSDrFlO7uHeFZldOXFQ.text: Probably gonna come back here every time I come to Vegas, if I can. I got a shrimp taco and a regular fish taco, both grilled. Both delicious.  The restaurant has an island feel, decorated nicely. They keep it clean, and the staff is really friendly and helpful. The prices are also reasonable, so it's pretty much great all around.

va6LRyUlMx_lV5t12qxSog.text: It's just okay. Taco shells chewy maybe because it's slightly fried and tostada all wet and soggy can't even pick it up to eat. Also ordered the surf and turf fries, hardly any steak/shrimp on there for the price they charge.

2g4p6ATqMkhksjo-cJiByA.text: This is the closest thing to San Diego seafood tacos you can get in Vegas!! It was jam packed on a Friday at lunch, for good reason. The seafood was fresh, and everything was made to order. Highly recommend the octopus taco, shrimp taco and any of the tostadas!!

8e2-jkAGtiFmekJwazECpQ.text: I liked the atmosphere and service was unremarkeable but our fish tacos were soggy and tasted terrible.  Total let down as the reviews are so good and the photos on the tables looked so much better than what we were served.  If you want amazing fish tacos get some at El Compita @ Charleston & Jones ONLY on Fridays.

75yaIMdlOfU6503f7wzPig.text: Try this place!!! The fish is so fresh and the flavors mixed in are perfection. Try the octopus  taco, very good. The ambiance is small and quick, it's part of the character. Service was fast, helpful and friendly.

ySkuKYrf2xteApjzYHda6g.text: This is simply the best hidden gem in town! I kid you not. They make everything fresh. Everything is original and frickin damn tasty. The owner along with his daughter work the frontline and they along with their staff are really friendly. This by no means is a huge restaurant, the overall look and experience of this place reminds me of a small hometown feel near the ocean.  The spicy octopus tacos are absolutely amazing and they make the best micheladas in town, and I've been all over the Valley drinking those! I believe the guacamole is made per order too! There are many great dishes on their menu and I will be determined to try them all....

QC8LhtbF5SG0jPuXDbLdsQ.text: DELICIOUS and affordable seafood tacos/ceviches. The restaurant is off the strip but worth the 15 min drive out!  If you don't want your ceviches too sour, ask them to go easy on the lime. Owner is very passionate!

w0d2W7SqChs4T7EEROneWg.text: This place is DEFINITELY SOLID! I've eaten at a lot of taco joints before but they seem to offer a very unique flavor and spin on their tacos that I can't place my fingers on but can certainly taste.  First off, they have parking so that was already a plus. When we walked in, we opted for the bar area and it was great because we got to see the cook and staff full in action.   Ended up ordering four items on their menu. Their raw Shrimp Tostada, which is a definite must if you enjoy raw shrimp like I do. The raw shrimp was creamy and fresh with a good lime kick. As for their Camaron (Shirmp) Enchilado, Octopus Enchilado and Bajamar Fish Taco was also very tasty too. With the combination of their thinly shredded cabbage, mayo and other fresh ingredients, it just brought everything together and made it work.   Lastly, we also ordered their Horchata  and it tasted great and certainly hit the spot. Overall, just please that we choose this spot to enjoy a great lunch and their customer service is outstanding.

yBd8FTR9TGsEOyVbdm7BSg.text: Some of the best seafood tacos around. Specifically, the octopus. Tender, succulent, spicy, with a crispy shell and smooth mozzarella to round out the flavors. Absolutely fantastic.  Enjoy!

KDLN5kwLsDu9Vc9lb3Pl4g.text: I found this by accident. We were on our way home from downtown last night, looking for a place to eat and Bajamar showed up on Google maps.  Not checking reviews prior,  we were a little concerned about the location...OMG! Freshest seafood tacos, BEST flavor combinations, and I woke up thinking about how amazing the food was. The Surf and Turf fries were phenomenal. The green Aguachile was truly one of the best dishes I have EVER had, and the Tsunami Tostada was absolutely delicious. My husband and I talked about going back today to try more items (easily a 45-minute drive), but then we found out about location #2 on Blue Diamond, which is a 15-minute drive from my house and a 5-minute drive from my work. To say that we are THRILLED is an understatement. I guarantee that we will become regulars! This place is freaking AWESOME!

MiWrkKbb-YDs5pXoRJVCOA.text: This restaurant was great for service and the food was amazing. The best tacos in town, hands down. Try the spicy shrimp taco, surf & turf fries and ceviches. My new favorite place! Also they just opened up a second location.

ZhVtx7xJF9-gEW9fdbQvgA.text: We love this place and have come here several time. The food is very fresh and tasty and the service is A++. The dishes come out quickly and there is a great selection with different flavors. There is not that much seating but the service is fast and worth the wait if they are busy.

o_2jdMXgQ1ECKYqKcBpISQ.text: Cool little beach shack and the tacos weren't too bad! The only thing missing was the beach!!! Although, they forgot to put the avocado on one of the tacos, even though it says avocado right on the menu!

1EGvzJQthWDdYg_PxdavJg.text: Loved this place, tastes just as delicious when visiting Ensenada Baja Mex.  I couldn't have enough of their fish tacos as they're my fav.  Will be returning as soon as I can scavenge enough money to hit the slots again.   As for those that prefer to eat Asada Tacos at a place called "Bajamar Seafood", why?  I guess I should try eating Chinese Food at KFC to understand these people. LOL  Enjoy, you won't be disappointed

17Rc8T6UiHsSHOOdWzsQfw.text: I never know what taco is what but order that same things everytime and we eat them all. Were pestcatrian who loves tacos so you guys saved our bellies and craving! Will be back yup almost every week. It's like crack. That good.

8dJVDOYPJC_pmmPqmRLDZg.text: Hole in the wall spot for seafood. Amazing fish and shrimp tacos. Authentic. Owner ran the bar/food and we were well taken care of. Would highly recommend.

BZSIohlujLABEbkQnOhAzA.text: The place is at the end of the strip and I wasn't sure to walk in from the look outside. Still tried it and food if pretty ok.. i wouldn't call great food, but just good. We tried several tacos and tostadas. Spicy shrimp tacos were good

3NZjNa6BcyV2UukGjrwipQ.text: I just INHALED three grilled shrimp tacos from Bajamar. It's right down the street from my house, and it's going to be a problem.   Decently priced, quick and very friendly service, and the best fish tacos in Vegas. I'm so hooked. See what I did there?   This is my third visit, and each time I've left super happy and satisfied. I've had both grilled and fried shrimp tacos, and some of their fish tacos which were all equally amazing. Their horchata is a bit too sweet for my liking, but don't let that stop you from ordering it. The sauce they put on the tacos isn't too heavy and overpowering and lets the rest of the flavors come through. I'm so excited to have this gem in Downtown Las Vegas!

ADgauNROKbMdFvs3Rl-Y9w.text: 5 stars entirely justified.  They're so far ahead of the curve it's ridiculous.  I come here every week on my day off to treat myself to the best Baja style Mexican food in Vegas.    One small quip, their fried fish taco is good, no doubt about it, by far better than any in Vegas.  But for me the best things on the menu are the marlin, the lucas, the pulpo, the mixed ceviche tostada, and the aguachile verde.  That marlin taco is one of the best things I've eaten all year, it's ridiculous.

W1teLPWWQBBwAyiC9e9a8w.text: Read the reviews and figured I'd try this place out. Not sold on it at all. The guacamole lacked flavor and was a rather small portion for the price. It had absolutely no flavor what so ever. It's okay to use seasonings. Had the fish taco and octopus taco and it lacked flavor and very gamey. Just tasted like oil from the fryer. Definitely not a place I would suggest unless you're into bland food. Very overpriced. The can of coca-cola I had however was amazing.

he6yPFd84AW9zFloYFBCUA.text: Could not recommend enough! We live a few blocks over and have been seeing everybody rant and rave about Bajamar in our neighborhood Facebook group. Decided to check it out and we were thoroughly  impressed. Manny was so nice and the food was delicious. We each had 3 tacos and a drink and our bill came out to $25. Very reasonable for the quality of food you are getting. Will be going back to try other things on the menu.  Side note: fish tacos are $2.50 on mondays and tuesdays

photos.caption: Photo of Bajamar Seafood & Tacos - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish taco, octopus taco, shrimp taco

kaHHqpidMXdaXjSZk_ReZg.text: Best fish tacos I've ever had my whole life. Their battered fried fish taco is out of this world. Definetely recommend.

nD0NygTB-c_4wHVaLJwzJg.text: This place is great comfort food.  Don't let the location spook you. Food is worth it and it's a great price. On Mondays and Tuesdays even a better price. Hubby and I can leave full for just about $20 (and that includes x2 ice teas).  Service-has always been friendly and helpful.  Food- always yummy.  Price- awesome

ljDVKO7fCtTVurt0WKDXrQ.text: Amazing food. The spicy octopus tacos to die for. Wife had both the green and bajamar agua Chile tostada. Manny the owner very attentive and great service. Thank you.

86F6TnUeFKI5JBEWNL6ihA.text: Okay so I saw this place on yelp but when we arrived in the parking lot we almost didn't go in. Seemed like a sketchy area but decided to brave it and so glad we did! Food is absolutely amazing!!! Started with one taco and ended up ordering a bunch of other things. Everything was perfectly cooked and seasoned, came out hot and tickled the tastebuds! Definitely coming here again. Oh and definitely try the octopus tacos.

photos.caption: Photo of Bajamar Seafood & Tacos - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GUPTUOZiTNTLllDX9Wr-Vw.text: It was perfectly cooked and so good I couldn't tell I was eating octopus which I thought I hated and ended up liking it.

U1x_xIiE3Cm9a7Xq1A3T0Q.text: The menu is very surprising. I was immediately intrigued. It's an awesome spin to authentic Mexican flavors and traditional plates. All I'm missing is the beach because mentally the food took me there.

CGlNGGh-sq5QPHri84U4Vg.text: Oh M Gee..... My first Marlin taco a Las Bresas was amazing! The flavor had depth and wasn't overly spicy.   The shrimp tacos were delicious!  I had the Gobernador, he had the Cameron Enchilado. Mine had sauteed shrimp with bell pepper, cilantro and Monterey Jack cheese. His had sauteed shrimp with Cole de arbol, Monterey Jack, red cabbage, and salsa fresca. We tried something really new for us in the Aguachile Bajamar with marinated shrimp in lime juice with bets, habanero and jicama. I had an issue with the texture of the rest shrimp but Greg loved it. The service was great. The manager wanted to take the aguachile off our bill because we didn't like it, we told him no. How sweet of him to offer.  The atmosphere is chill with Reggae music in the background. The base is beautiful. We will be coming back and bringing friends

1ATwjIwcbAzqLQftqHLjJg.text: spicy shrimp tacos this is not a game get you're mind right worth the trip take a taxi ten minutes from the strip

nmVDGmjsD7kGKNYSR9ZUmA.text: Love this place. Tried the spicy octopus taco, love at first bite. If your a seafood fan you have to try this place....Fish, scallops, octopus, shrimp, Ceviche!! Very clean, friendly staff. Enjoy bob marley while you eat!!! I'll be back....

FIYwFhwxEQ5NXCr_4_gR_w.text: Best tacos I've ever had! Plus the customer service was great! The atmosphere is very chill and inviting.

ApWdv1frawJDikIHAhT1Iw.text: Wow! Just, WOW! Killer, fresh seafood tacos! Along with some chips, guacamole and a michelada, I enjoyed one of the shrimp options and the marlin. After contemplating life choices, I felt that a I needed one more to put me right where I needed to be and upon Manny's recommendation, I opted for the octopus. Amazing little taco joint on the strip but away from the tourists. If you don't eat here, you really need to contemplate your poor life choices.

photos.caption: Photo of Bajamar Seafood & Tacos - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House-made michelada!

QxclIoQ9sGhFq_cnHqbBGg.text: Best shrimp tacos ever!!!!Manny the owner treats us very good every time we come here

gMs5E3TwHDtuLXlg6aQl9w.text: This place is a hidden gem! The octopus taco is fantastic! Manny, the owner is very friendly and humble. The atmosphere is great and the place looks very nice and clean. So glad I ventured out and found this place. Go there now, and be delighted! :)

MKMcc5xL8z3AAw1TiKD3Ww.text: Sooo gooooood! Never know whether to trust reviews but this place is such a gem. Amazing AUTHENTIC food. Fish tacos are wonderful. Fresh tasting and good texture. Service was friendly and helpful. Horchata was the best I've ever had. Eat here.

Pnq5IRlexBF3J2Rx9z2GDw.text: This is a great spot for mariscos (seafood). The fish tacos come highly recommended as well as the tostadas. We will definately be back.

F0jjvsJpo2CtOInw4VDPRA.text: Vacationing from out of town. Tried the fish, shrimp, and octopus taco. They all are very good. The octopus is a bit soft for my liking. Overall great food great attentive service. Will def try again the next time in town.

96pKuzThf4bdUUpfCahXSw.text: We had the fish, shrimp, octopus and marlin tacos. All amazing, fresh and fast. My favorite was the fried fish and the tender spicy pulpo. Love the beach shack decor too. Can't wait to go back.

MTOAx6hCcj1GU1gKJlM5kw.text: Best fish tacos, best agua de orchata & best homemade cheesecake I've ever had!! Definitely returning to eat here again!!

ouYZBn3F-7oVbP8xDh_xFQ.text: I've been here 2x and have absolutely loved it.  Its worth the downtown traffic to get these tasty tacos. 2 tacos are filling, but 3 tacos gets me really full. The staff is really friendly, service is quick and the restaurant is clean with a positive vibe.  Its not a big place so for groups larger than 4 will have to sit at separate tables.

c3hZnnmQrO-FfsTxzGGhXg.text: Amazing Restaurant!!! I came in right before closing they let us stay as long as we wanted. The food recommendations were amazing!  I had the pulpo taco it the best I have ever had!! Manny Thank it was truly a pleasure meeting you. You made our night!!

o5KC3jqPz3gaXejR2XFM1Q.text: Only game in the city for this fare. If you've ever been to fishers in Mexico Bajamar is a us version of that. It's great. Give it a try. It's worth it. I hope to see Peruvian ceviche (dorado) for my next visit.

YWSAOuVoBSu-u_Y-lpUAww.text: Yes yes yes, this is the perfect fish taco!  Anyone craving baja style fish tacos this is the spot. Mon and Tues 2.50 fish taco special. Friendly service and fish taco perfection, this place is Baja done right. Right here in downtown LV. Thank you Bajamar, I'll be back at least once a week. I miss you Ensenada but now there's no rush to get back.  The only thing that could have made the experience better was if I had Mexican cerveza to wash it down. But they had Mexican coke and I was on my lunch break so no complaints here.

CkdTRfZG4vryvCHl4xh_KQ.text: Yet another five star review. Service was prompt and friendly. The pulpo tacos were spicy tender and fantastic. This place could easily hold its own in San Diego. Much preferred to the absurd sameness of restaurants on the strip.

o1JLS88jdXnmufdRMIQjVA.text: What a great new addition to the neighborhood.  I had the signature fish taco. It was delicious. The menu will beckon me back to eventually sample everything.   The service was provided by the owned, Manny, who's pride and attention to detail makes this place a must-visit.

WBDsACtAVt9ZLRBfgOYgRw.text: Best mariscos in Vegas.  The food is amazing! Try the the Lucas taco, Cameron enchilada, or the pulp taco and you won't be disappointed.  The food is reasonably priced and the service is on point.  Make sure you stop in next time you are in Vegas.

UCqprnUT4bcNKeXya-_iag.text: These tacos are amazing!!!  Try the Gubernador Taco. It's the best shrimp taco I've ever had. Very friendly people and a low key, dive feel. It's not every day you find a taco joint that makes food this good!  Make time for this stop next time you're in Vegas!

0NzIyIf4BgsB4U_W_24zNg.text: Best seafood in town. Octopus tacos are my favorite. Monday and Tuesday fish tacos are in special and are delicious. Friendly staff.

cAD15z_P-nl72uTpkY3CUQ.text: Went here for the first time for a friend's birthday a week ago. I will definitely be returning. The food is excellent. The food is fresh and the flavors are on point. You can taste the individual ingredients. I enjoyed a Mixteco tostada and a Pulpo taco recommended by our waiter.  Comfortable atmosphere and attentive service. You can't beat the price. On the strip, easy to reach. Local favorite.

fZrY-N3bW1SFzx7uImcaEg.text: The food was great! I was craving seafood and Bajamar definitely hit the spot! Our server was extremely friendly and made sure we attended. We will definitely be back for more, now that we have found a great seafood. Be sure to try the Shrimp cocktail and Horchata, Delicious!

GmyZ5psaH5mTUSlORDtrqQ.text: Best kept secret. Food is fresh and delicious! The stuffed pepper taco was incredibly tasty

R0bAc-_NCAImncSQv9rS-Q.text: I Loved the shrimp tacos and the chipotle sauce ! Great service. delicious and fresh .  Perfection!  I totally recommend . I'm bringing my family next time I go :)

q4mPrRb7tb44U35EQzH86A.text: I can honestly say I got SoCal beach flashbacks eating my fish tacos! The mixture of sauces and spices & fresh fish just blew my mind ! And not to mention the great customer service!! Im hooked !!  And I forgot to mention he hooked up my vegetarian buddy with his tacos making them veggi style making A+++ !!!
