bmN_QBG_ImAZCa5A9vTwDw.text: Tried this place for the first time today, it was really good! The staff was super friendly and helpful with choosing an dish. Restrooms were clean! I recommend trying the aguachilie verde, super sour because the lime is used to cook the shrimp. Also the surf and turf fries were delicious! Would love to try more items.

CJ63QixfqeNJiNQFfH9sdw.text: Absolutely Awesome Tacos! Shrimp Tacos w Lucas Were My Favorite! I Was Looking For A Mexican Vegan Restaurant And I Think I Lucked UP Going Here Instead. I Will Definitely Be Going Back With Friends.

tbRV4oPy-oSlja1az4Yvow.text: This is my favorite place for tacos in town. The owner runs the show here and the vibe feels like vacation. Bajamar has the freshest octopus in town and the best seafood tacos by far. This is a locals staple for authentic tacos.

cfVkrmIsHOwVHeWHR7EFOw.text: This place is a little small, BUT the food was AMAZING!!! I got the Bajamar fish tacos which were super delicious. Best fish tacos I've ever had. I also ordered their shrimp tostada which was yummy too!!! The gentleman named Manny was very respectful and professional. I'll definitely be back when I get my fish taco cravings :)

qzpmJM-GekWIvPlcB1gDrQ.text: Fantastic food, service and establishment. Walked pretty far to find this little gem. Well worth it. Delicious seafood tacos. Wonderful horchata. Super clean restaurant and our server was one of the nicest people I've meet in a while. Wish we lived here so I could visit this restaurant often. Keep on being amazing.

3-_UwH1HEALIG7cW5D_7aQ.text: Manny is the best! He stayed open late for us even though they were closed. Manny is the owner and spoke with us the whole time. I cannot believe the restaurant is run by only 3 people. True story: I was in an Uber on my way to another restaurant. We were driving by and it seemed like a fun and unique place. I asked the Uber driver to drop me off. I was 2 blocks away and walked to the restaurant. Best decision ever!! The food was amazing and best seafood tacos I've had in all of Vegas. Highly recommend it and will be coming back to eat here this weekend. Thanks again Manny and staff!!

JlYub1ohO1N_ANRFH4SDPg.text: Had the pleasure of dining at this gem tonight. The food is fantastic! Tried the Tacos de Camaron and they did not disappoint. Manny is a genuinely friendly person/host. I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a bite while out on the town.

AxQWJewyUwN8AUgb27Ib-g.text: This was at 1st glance iffy. But being inside it was a warm feel with amazing food! I got the fish tostada, fish battered taco also a grilled shrimp taco. Side of beans and rice with a Jamaica to drink. Took me waaaaaay back from when I was little in Mexico. Defiantly recommend it!

5ZsJ10daMkKTvH2_K-6OgA.text: ohhhh man this is some great food!  The fish tacos and pulpo are delicious here and the place has a warm welcoming.  If you want to be creative and add shrimp to your quesadilla go for it, Bajamar will accommodate your request.  The fish tacos took me back to my childhood days when i'd go to Ensenada, Mexico with my grandma and eat near the port. Good times...  Thank You Bajamar, we'll be back :)

photos.caption: Photo of Bajamar Seafood & Tacos - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TJokewZ515eRqIhrws430Q.text: Highly recommended! Bajamar is the perfect foodie stop if you're traveling North on The Strip up to the Arts District/Fremont Street area. I ordered the fish tacos, grilled and the chipotle sauce is mouth watering. There was no guacamole on the menu but they whipped some up for me on the spot the way I like it with lots of cilantro, fresh avocados and easy on the onions. Service was top notch. I love the decor of surfboards and Baja California beach art, like a Baja seaside food shack had been uprooted and transplanted on the Las Vegas Strip.

XvCLQAesRO4c9OVgiXUi4Q.text: Excellent sea food, best I ever try in long time. True Mexican style, limonadas and horchata are great.

CmAHlS2Ytoy0RoyPZceXbw.text: I never even liked fish tacos until I came here and now I dream about them. It's all I want to eat.

dg3uDVULtcBtVx5_OA59pg.text: Great food, great guy! We had fun and the food is great, the location is a little spartan, but highly recommended

fGyF5tlhVKNq_uWSnD8WBA.text: Amazing food, fresh, and fast! The owner provides great service and will ensure you have a great meal!

Th6NInI5Ym1J-stQWz-xJA.text: AMAZING fish tacos! The one in the picture is the BajaMar beer battered fish taco (which you can also get grilled).  They were the perfect size and deliciously topped with chipotle crema, repollo, and salsa fresca. The hisbiscus (Jamaica) water was just the right amount of sweet & tart. The perfect ending to our meal was the homemade cheesecake which was suggested by the restaurant manager, Manny - who was also great conversation and all around nice guy. Definitely going back!

JamlOuPL9KVSGl-lKz9ZTw.text: This place is amazing! I had fish, shrimp, and octopus tacos and a ceviche tostada. All of them were very delicious. The owner was super nice and friendly too. I'll definitely be back.

tyD2HPLPtZRxE4rkuFaGTw.text: Can't say enough good things! The service was friendly and speedy. The fish taco was good, the shrimp taco was great, and the octopus taco was seriously life changing. The second I took a bite I started thinking about all of the people I wanted to take here to experience it too. Cant wait to come back.

isgLvoyQ3tZho2BlVq-ikQ.text: I always passed by this place and its right next yo my work.  Decided to give it a shot and I'm glad I did. Best fish tacos I've had since san Diego

R8ymHQ-fiBi_wtn_FESEnw.text: This place was such a great find! The food is absolutely delicious - so full of flavor! And the service is fast and friendly. Get the horchata - seriously the best I've ever had. Also had the shrimp tostada and shrimp taco - can't even begin to describe how amazing they were! Highly recommend.

o_C-b3BIL3Q_jBbDRUPoOg.text: Best Seafood tacos in Vegas & Henderson,  If you like San Diego style tacos then this is the spot for You!!! Freaking delicious.

iOtxT8TQrqEAsiuugAkqHg.text: Loved sitting at the counter for a quick lunch bite. The fish tacos were delicious but next time I'm getting a plate full of amazing octopus tacos. Easy parking. Super fast and friendly service.

Z2KQGHbOTJjacgnk2pcHwQ.text: Stunningly delicious food! Owner welcoming and obviously dedicated and passionate. BajaMar alone is worth the 8 hour drive to Vegas. Cannot wait to eat there again soon!!!!

8TUU0ZfuV3KqaqvGf6p98g.text: Don't go to Vegas without stopping here. Fresh food perfectly prepared at the right price. This place is well worth a slight detour off the beaten path. Not far from Nellis AFB and even closer to the strip. Very clean and cool place to stop in for amazing food and a cold beer. I had the "tsunami tostada" and have been craving another ever since. The owner (who served us) has a great staff who were all prompt, courteous and attentive. Thanks for the stickers!

T6fmA55agGgJSilERQZW7g.text: Food was fresh and outstanding!! Service was very attentive. They had a plaque on the wall for "Hidden Gem" award and I have to thoroughly agree

RwWHk8arUGRC7ddkGVE1Jg.text: It's actually better than all the glowing reviews would lead you to believe. Had a cooked shrimp taco and ceviche tostada after consulting with the waitress. Also, horchata. It was all amazing. I can't say anything more than what others have expressed. Well worth the visit.

dZiI3k2tPltkL7notRZSKQ.text: Theeeee best tacos I've ever had. I wasn't expecting to experience something so magical. I got spicy shrimp and carne asata tacos. They were so juicy and flavorful. The staff was also very pleasant. I wish there was a location in Georgia.

qP5Ar2-ZCEpHhrvAlH5uuQ.text: This place is amazing! Everything I tasted was delicious! The service was great with very cool atmosphere!I will definitely be back!

8b496zaQFbEjO8kScZ7HNw.text: All my past experience has been with tacos to go.  Finally made it to @BajamarLV to eat on-premise right off the line. These tacos are really good.  We had the Shrimp Ceviche Tostada, Sauteed Shrimp Taco, Sauteed Octopus Taco and one off the menu Sauteed Marlin Taco. At first I thought I liked the Octopus taco the most but the truth is everything was done really well. From perfectly crisped tortillas on the flattop to the fish and even the limes were super juicy (Nothing I hate more then someone give me a three day old dried up lime with my taco or tequila).  This is an owner operated establishment and the owner we met cares. Love that. If you are in the mood for a fish taco I suggest you find your way over here. -

4WF-IePFNCtkbvWN2ugr9Q.text: Wow, these tacos were AMAZING. I can't wait to go back and eat more. Their service was great. The man who was taking care of us was really nice and very attentive. The inside of this place is SO CUTE and you would never think it was when seeing it from the outside. This is really one of my favorite spots now.

1C0LnfnaCigtO7Vs_unWUA.text: Such a great place with amazing service and delicious food!! It's a little hole in the wall but the quality of food that comes out of there is next level, but I do love a good divey restaurant!! The tostada mixta is so good. It is huge tho! I ordered that, a couple tacos, and was in over my head, they're def not shy about the portion of seafood they give you!  I always grab an octopus taco whenever I'm there, it's so unique and tasty! Wash it all down with a Mexican coke or a michelada and you're set!

HhS8vaIfpNXq5v07nVnkuA.text: The best fish tacos EVER!!!  The staff is really nice and will guide you and suggest all the popular food. If you are looking for fresh seafood that's affordable and yummy, I highly suggest this place.

nJ0OOtr9ulB24y4avBiBvw.text: This is my 2nd time visiting Manny at BajaMar.... and once again... not just great...$%^&*&ing great!   You can't beat the Tsunami Tostada or the Spicy Octopus taco.  But I'm certain everything else is excellent too.  And if you like draft beer...ask them to line the rim with Tahin'.   You'll love it!

BherTTuzmBnPatJxfqSeAg.text: Months ago I had contacted this spot to see if their beans and rice were vegan and they are!  I had a cheat day (I avoid consuming oil) and decided to head to Bajamar. I was greeted by Manny the owner and he took care of me!  I got a side of beans and rice and he made me some super duper yummy tacos.  Avocado tacos with alllll the fixings. Packed with veggies and creamy fresh avocado. Wow! Make sure you get a side of his hot sauce YUM!!!!   The beans were packed full of flavor and the rice was nice with corn throughout.   I took my food to go but I'll have to come back a sit up at the bar area. I bet it's a great place to people watch lol. Manny is a doll and is passionate about food and this nice place.   Super cute place, go there and support local businesses!

5ahMNFd7VgVq9daXrqdktw.text: Really delicious fish and shrimp tacos. Highly recommend. Friendly people. And clean place.

le-NIZ9pDkqKPw_s2fTLaw.text: Having lunch with my gallerest solving the problems of the art world is a must requiring great food and laughter.  It is an exciting event and for the occasion, we chose Bajamar Seafood and Tacos.  Everything on the fairly extensive menu is ala carte -- If one can eat more than one taco, they'd have to be more than ravenous.  The service was sublime and prompt, even though it was packed -- for good reason.  The food was exceptional and flavorable -- yum yum.

HFOjuWpt0bvvJkdp1mGPUw.text: Great beverages and wonderful staff but that's it for me. The chips are so hard, they cut your gums so only carefully feed them to kids, if at all. Tacos are floating in grease on the plate and lack flavor.  I went for ratings and so will you so good luck!

d97bAEoGIf4B09KG9cRpIw.text: Great food at a great price ! The mixed seafood tostada and the pulpo tacos were my favorite! They make their own horchata in house for only $1.50 - a steal !  Very clean and beautifully decorated.  Can't wait for them to get their wine&beer license and pair that with my food !  Thank you for opening this awesome seafood spot !

nxG_SKoHB7Xwty5S8UDWHA.text: Hidden gem! Been here 4 times and never been disappointed by the food or the service. The owner is very nice and friendly. Place is clean. Definitely recommend!

9uUypJJsE6G-k5OyG2tq9w.text: I would do some unspeakable things for good tacos. Things that would make my mother disown me and a priest blush. Fortunately, I can just buy sinfully delicious tacos at Bajamar and forgo selling myself for tacos.  I've had some good and highly rated tacos in my life. Including seafood tacos on beaches in San Diego and Mexico. I have never eaten a taco that made my mouth dance like the octopus tacos at Bajamar. The briney, succulent, tender octopus with Just the right amount of spice in a freshly fried tortilla with the perfect sauces and cabbage on top.  Every bite was an ever-changing barrage of flavor. I got two other tacos, but honestly I could eat the octopus tacos all day every day from now until I die.  The Lucas was very unique. A grilled Anaheim Chile stuffed with cheese and shrimp topped like a taco and in a tortilla vessel. It was like a shrimp Chile relleno but instead of being fried bring stuffed in a taco shell. Their standard fish taco was also yummy but not life altering like the octopus taco.   There are only two other bites of food I've had my entire life that I will never forget. I will always remember my first time with their octopus taco. I feel like I just spent the night with a dream girl, but now I'm waiting in bed trying to plot a way to see her again without seeming desperate.

tfNQ5l8KN_Mh_sPXHrWkQA.text: These craft tacos are so legit. I ordered two and couldn't quite finish the meal. The spicy octopus was unbelievably delicious. VI8AurCNhoiyfzueWxbl0Q.text: This is the closest comparison to the seafood and tacos in San Diego that I found in Las Vegas.   That tostada mixta, it's super good. This is probably my favorite plate here. It comes on a tostada shell with a seafood mix on top mixed in a tomato based sauce. That sauce is legit.  If you come on Monday or Tuesdays the fish tacos are only 2.50 and you can ask for it either battered or grilled. The size of tacos are decently sized too, not those small 2 bite tacos.  People that like spicy stuff you can also ask for the homemade habanero sauce, it's not really spicy but it taste so good on the tacos.

zhFiMurgAvMxp9atUbJk5A.text: I had just flown in from the East Coast and as soon as I checked into my hotel room, I did a Yelp search for seafood. Bajamar came up, but not really what I had in mind. I was looking for an all-you-can-eat seafood buffet, however the 5-star reviews of Bajamar quickly dashed my buffet idea out the window.   The location is north of the strip with plenty of free parking right in front of the restaurant. As soon as I opened the door, this super friendly man (Manny was his name) greeted me. I knew what I wanted, but I also wanted Manny's opinion. I was curious about this Horchata drink, and he said I would love it. It's made with rice that's been soaked overnight, then blended, then strained, then added with evaporated milk, vanilla, and cinnamon.....and Voila! You get this refreshing non-alcoholic drink! So good I had 2 jars.   Then I asked him what his favorite taco was: Pulpo Enchilado. Great!! That's what I wanted to get anyway, Manny! It's this taco filled with huge chunks of sauteed octopus, red cabbage, salsa, Monterey Jack cheese, then sprinkled with this potent Mexican chili pepper. I greedily ordered 3 of these tacos, as Manny's eyes widened. So I asked him, "Do you think that's enough? Should I order an appetizer too?" He said, "No that should be more than enough for you." :-) Okay then.  Food came. Wow. Never had I enjoyed tacos as much as I did that day. Every bite was Mmm Mmm good. I was a total mess! But most Mmm Mmm moments are usually messy. I managed to eat all 3 with the same gusto as that first initial bite. All wonderfully filled with tender octopus, seasoned just right.   After my over indulgence, I chatted a bit with Manny. Come to find out, he is the co-owner of this restaurant. No wonder he takes such great care & appreciation toward his customers. The other owner is the man who makes all of these delicious food in the kitchen. The pair are originally from Tijuana, then moved to San Diego, and have now settled in Las Vegas. It's not the best neighborhood in Vegas, but sometimes you find hidden gems in places like this. Bajamar won 2018 Best Tacos From The Sea by the Las Vegas Weekly. I can't help but think that this is really what makes America great, isn't it? Achieving a lifetime dream and working hard to maintain that dream, no matter where you come from. Manny, thank you so much for your hospitality. Wishing you and your partner much success!

It was quite spicy, but good.   I would give it 5 stars but they didn't have seat ahi tuna. But had smoked tuna on the menu. But not sure why they can't sear the tuna    The bathroom was pretty clean for the age of the building.   They only had beer, no liquor.

photos.caption: Photo of Bajamar Seafood & Tacos - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The menu... sadly they only have beer

qzgENU0JGrC9YO0nkWhAfw.text: Guys! Don't even second guess it, don't go back to look for other options to think about for lunch or dinner.  Seriously so bomb!  It took me a bit to find this place but it was worth the stupid turns google maps gave me.  Made me drive in circles.  But mannn ohh mannnn.... so worth it.  I would do it all over again actually.   My favorite was the Lucas Taco.  That sucker is heaven.  A cheesy Chile with shrimp and cabbage with some bomb sauce, oh my my myyyyy.   I also ordered a battered fish taco, well, because you must always order one when you're at a seafood taco spot.  Annnddd, andddd.... it was just as delicious but still my favorite ... was the Lucas Taco.  I ordered a Chelada to wash all that yumminess down and  It was a perfect fit.  So refreshing and it complimented the dishes perfectly.  Now, we also ordered 2 tostadas.  A shrimp ceviche and and the fish in aqua Chile.  If you like spice with some major mouth watering lemon action.... I say go for it.  You will not regret it.  We asked for extra tostada because they place a mountain of all that goodness in one perfectly toasted tortilla.  Ask for extra to scoop up all the extra goodness.     Stop by, order yourself some bomb food and leave with a huge smile on your face and you'll probably be back later for more because it's that good.  Thank me later.   Salud!

I enjoyed the spicy octopus and shrimp tacos with the best guacamole I've had in years! Service was friendly and fast. The interior is clean &  Modelo is served ice cold! *trythemangosalsa

f6JnyKGJkBLQ4IykPfqmfg.text: If you like fish tacos you have to come here.  These are by far the best fish tacos in Vegas.  I constantly crave these tacos. They are so fresh and delicious.  Wash it down with a horchata and I'm in heaven.  It is hard to do but I try and save room for Luv-It which is right behind Bajamar.  Perfect meal.  Service can be hit or miss but the tacos make up for it.    They are opening a 2nd location in the Southwest on Blue Diamond and Cimmaron.

GyjIzV0H1vEbN55nNmeGGQ.text: Sadly our follow up visit was a flop. The carne Asada taco was unrecognizable. It was over cooked, stew like and grey with a dollop of guacamole. Where is the sear on the meat? Where is the bold seasoning? Fresh avocado slices? Pico? I have literally told everyone that this was hands down the best carne taco I've ever had and this was not that. Kinda of gross to be honest. I hope everyone I've told to go there got the good version because what we got was not ok.   On this occasion, everything was served very fast which differed from before. It all seemed thrown together. Flavors were just ok and not developed. Seafood did get the full acid cooked textures. The raw shrimp in the Tsunami was slimy, mushy and grey. Not edible.  Bajamar fish taco was ok. Aquachile green was the best thing today and still average at best. The fried piece fish was cold but at least the flavor was ok.   The whole visit was disappointing and not worth the uber drive to and from our hotel on this particular day. This Definitely was a different staff and cook then before. Consistency is key and they did not meet up with our expectations. We haven't given up hope though . We plan to revisit Bajamar for a redemption visit. You were our number 1 vegas choice and we need you to get it together!!!

0uEJ3kXVi_37sd3uKXz3AA.text: The best seafood tacos in Vegas & arguably one of the top seafood taco spots in the entire US! The location is a bit sketch, but this place is spectacular. The inside is pretty tiny, maybe 4 tables and a bar area so I'd imagine the weekends get packed.   On my first visit we asked the waitress for her favorite and she recommended the octopus taco. I had one of those along with a spicy shrimp taco. Both were AMAZING! The spicy mayo sauce was the best part & the seafood was very fresh. I could literally eat this every day. The tacos are a bit better than street taco size so 2-3 is plenty.   Their menu also features tostadas and seafood soups. I can't wait to come back and try more. A must visit for any seafood lover!

xX4chOO6BdALgqPpVHJYrQ.text: Hands down the BEST tacos in Las Vegas !   The service is amazing , Manny is an awesome manager and always makes me feel right at home. The location is small but the energy is big , you kind of feel transported out of vegas and into a California surf shack when you get here. sIO0qWHy0hKBZRBk9pfEzQ.text: I went here for a lunch today with my boyfriend because of the amazing reviews here on yelp. I ordered the spicy shrimp tacos (server recommendation) and a shrimp tostada (because I saw an amazing looking pic of it on here). I specifically  ordered the shrimp tostada because a picture of it on here showed that it is loaded with avocado on top.   1st, unfortunately the bottom of the spicy shrimp taco was literally dripping & pooling in grease. The menu description did not say that the tortilla is deep fried or whatever it was, so I was not expecting that. Other then that it tasted a bit chewy but otherwise good though.   2nd, the shrimp tostada did not have any avocado on it (see pic). I asked the server & she spoke to a guy behind the counter. A few minutes later she brought over a small little sauce cup with two little pieces of avocado in it. Total bummer. The shrimp was a cold, also unexpected.  And the sauce tasted like watery ketchup. I basically just picked out the little shrimp pieces and ate the avocado.    The interior is cutely decorated with a surfer vibe.

buxgrasSRURQ3kaBwBfexQ.text: OMFG!!!   This place is awesome and truly has earned their #1 spot in LV.   Yes, the best restaurant in LV really is a taco joint.   Food was a little slow getting there, but they cook everything fresh so....   The owner is pretty much there all day every day making sure things are done right, delivering food, and making sure you're taken care of.

ocuokyn4VcVnTj5egX21Fw.text: The 4 and a half star rating is a lot to live up to and charging $4+ per taco makes me grade that much harder but this place exceeded my expectations.   First, best supporting actor goes to the tortillas.   If you've eaten enough tacos (phrasing, boom), you know how a tortilla can get in the way of your enjoyment. Generally, you almost have to move the taco around in your mouth to enjoy it properly (phrasing, boom). But these tortillas were close to perfect. You bite into it and you taste *taco*, you don't taste a dry, mealy tortilla that happens to be holding some tasty veggies and protein. Also I dunno if it's fried or what but it's a soft "shell" taco that approaches crispy. It's not quite crispy, but it's right in the edge in a good way.  Back to taco tasting ;)  The surf N Turf taco is a prime example of a lot of ingredients working well together.   I don't tend to enjoy consuming multiple proteins in one bite because it has a tendency to turn into a mush with no distinct flavor. This is not the case here.   I tasted the fried onions, the guac, the juicy carne asada (I was super impressed by how good the meat was. This menu is basically all seafood and I kinda expected meh asada but this was pretty great. Some buddies got the asada by itself and seemed very happy with their choice), and the shrimp.   The skrimp. In a word. Succulent  Plump? Fresh? Flavorful?  Yeah, it's all those things but I think the word Succulent would be written on the trophy I'd award the shrimp in these tacos.   I did surf N Turf and my buddies indicated you can't go wrong with the spicy shrimp.   Random Tip: if you're used to spicy, the spicy won't bother you at all, but don't reach for the hot sauce right away. It's not spicy, but there's a bunch of flavor on it already. The hot sauce in the bottles at the table doesn't make it any spicier and it kinda ruins the taco imo. So at least take a bite before deciding to lay your sauce down (are we still doing phrasing?). For non spicy tacos you're probably good throw some hot sauce on right away.   Breaded v grilled fish taco isn't about health for me. If you actually like the taste of fish, grilled is the way to go. For me, the breading gets in the way of the flavor. I didn't have room to try the marlin or tuna but I heard rave reviews from the ppl in my party who did.   Also...if I may be so bold, spicy octopus is for ppl who actually like octopus. I'm a thin tentacle sort of guy (self-own) meaning calamari is my cephalapod of choice. I saw a lot of positive reviews for the spicy octopus and tried it. It wasn't for me but I've never really liked enjoyed octopus. Once the tentacles get to a certain thickness, I'm out. Next time I'll go for the calamari.   Aqua Fresca limeade is dope if you like lemonade. I do, so three cheers for that.   Now onto the service. I asked way too many ppl to come to dinner. And because these ppl don't quite hate me, a lot showed up. This is a small restaurant. Not a knock. Just fax. In spite of my party being way too large and everybody wanting their own check, the service was fast and they only seemed *kinda* mad at me for bringing way too many ppl to a place that can seat 35 at most.   If your group is down to do a one check per actual table thing, then maybe, Maybe, bring 16 ppl max. But this isn't a bar where you can come in with a huge group and float from table to table blessing your friends and acquaintances with your effervescence.   This is a place ideal for sitting down in one spot, eating food, drinking drink, and, at most, if you have an aisle seat and a voice that carries, talking to a diner in the table next to yours. If you want to bring a Group-group, you're probably better off trying to rent out the place, Mizz* Moneybags (*because I'm suuuuper woke). Keyword: small restaurant.   I probably forgot to say something. I'm tired of writing. I should proofread this.   PARKING! You're better off putting luv it custard in the GPS and parking in that parking lot and walking to Bajamar. They're literally right next to each other. The thing is, if you put bajamar in the GPS, you'll think there's only, like, 3 parking spots but there's actually plenty of parking right behind it.   I'm coming for you, Review of the day.  Also, $1 off the bajamar taco on Tuesdays.

c_D_WmwQHpd6zW1ns573Rw.text: Absolutely delicious! I had the tsunami tostada and everything was fresh.  Very good! I was surprise to find such a good place good food fair prices

XZgy9lyHMVJ_vqxoRBxZ5w.text: I admit I wasn't sure what to expect when we drove up, but now I'm definitely a fan of Bajamar! Food was cooked perfectly, great flavor and a little different from your typical Mexican spot.  We ordered the octopus cocktail, which is almost like a cold soup, filled with octopus, tomato, onion and other yumminess. The calamari chicharron was also very good - calamari battered with chicharron, which I've never had before. The shrimp and surf and turf tacos were great as well.  My only criticisms are: they only have canned/bottled drinks (no fountain) and the location is a little sketchy (I wouldn't feel safe going there alone at night). But I'll definitely be back for lunch!

1a8LLlLs4qSy2Uc1QH563w.text: Get the spicy octopus. Service was on point, food was fast and incredible. Best taco of my life. I'd move to Vegas for these tacos. Also, clever art on the bathroom doors. Thank you, Bajamar!

m00U2qb12CYOp1oC9ZAp-A.text: I didn't know what to expect upon walking up to the restuarant.  It looked small and the parking lot was tight.  I was thinking it was going to be one of those hole in the wall taco joints where the tables are dirty and the food looks questionable.  There was a line, about 3 parties ahead when my boyfriend and I walked in.  The restuarant had every table filled!  We waited for about 15 minutes and were seated.  Service was good, but a little slow since there was only 2 people working.  We placed our drink and food order at the same time.  I ordered the Shrimp Taco and the Spicy Shrimp Taco.  The tacos were slightly bigger than a street taco so it was filling.  Both tacos were very flavorful, so yummy!  I definitely like the spicy flavor more, it had a nice kick.  The shrimps tasted fresh and the vegetables were crunchy.  I'll definitely try the octopus taco next time.    My boyfriend ordered the Carne Asada Taco and the Surf N Turf Taco.  The meat was good, fresh tomatoes, and carmelized onions.  He ate it so fast!  Great taco place with amazing food!

Photo of Bajamar Seafood & Tacos - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Taco &amp; Spicy Shrimp Taco

0tDzkKkTWGbg_yIVvKGLkw.text: I heard of a tiny taco joint hidden away with some of the best seafood tacos around. Those were some big words to live up to, but after finally getting to try, I can confirm the rumors were better than True!  The place is small so expect some kind of wait, but the speed which everyone is running at, everything was done fairly quick. My group of friends ordered an assortment of tacos, and with every first bite followed an exclamation of joy. Every taco was amazing and offered different flavors. My table voted the spicy octopus as top taco, but only after a heated debate and a second round of ordering to confirm.  For the price, speed, and definitely the flavor, Bajamar should be on everyones radar for their lunch break taco fix!

_GLe1SVNhdppfgnAwwYivQ.text: If it is 5 stars in Taylor S.' book, game on!   A couple Modelos to start! Served with a lime. Refreshing and perfect for the vibe of this place. Small and intimate. Hip. Delicious food.   Surf and turf lived up to our dreams, but you better believe I'm going to have to run that fish off tomorrow. The quesadilla was simple and great. Julia R was a fan.    The winner at this place is easily the Bajamar grilled fish tacos. Holy fish. You can choose between grilled or fried. Grilled for me. They were perfectly cooked with the secret sauce and fresh diced tomatoes and cabbage like lettuce. They were perfect. I know I'll be dreaming about them for a while.   This place doesn't feel touristy at all, but it's close enough to the strip. It's a great place to kick start your night we ate for under $50 including tip, and we didn't hold back.   I hate to Yelp about best kept secrets. Oh well!

5azqaokl0_y-zQeLb_vvXg.text: I first ate here on Wednesday, September 27, 2017 and got the Bajamar fish taco and the shrimp ceviche tostada. Omg it was AMAZING! So fresh and amazing flavors. nAhPK2mFXJL-jxz-g3ewCA.text: Best fish tacos & Baja style seafood in town! Faves are the fish tostada & the pulpo taco. Fresh Jamaica is always amazing. Excellent service every single time. Favorite new spot downtown Las Vegas! I wish I could go right now ! Yum

6ux_u_R9Wsw2Ve9z5EywLg.text: A friend of mine told me I had to try this place. Amazing tacos! I got a shrimp and an octopus taco. Haven't really been to a place in Vegas that was like that place so I'll def be back. Nice spot. Very clean and great service.

30ijlKJsfqKo4bZ8hPA-8A.text: Came here on the recommendation of a few neighbors. The space is small but modern and very clean, much nicer than the average hole-in-the-wall mariscos place.   We got the cooked shrimp and mixed tostadas. They were loaded, had to break them up and finish with a fork. Could have used a little more avocado but still great for the price. Some of the best, most tender octopus "pulpo" I've ever had. I'll be coming back for that!   Also got the bajamar fish taco and camaron enchilado taco, which had amazing flavor and homemade tortillas.  Horchata $1.50 and delicious. Prices and service very good, one of my new favorite spots downtown!

5LsLw17dgS_rgm8GE1ISKA.text: Unquestionably the best meal I've ever had. The homemade horchata is incredible! The shrimp and octopus tacos unreal! Service amazing! Incredible spot! You gotta go!

hwHlQ2dKBiDJlXpRUNvxrg.text: This is a great spot. Food was fresh and far better than the many other mexican-style seafood places I have tried in Las Vegas. The owner, Manny, waited on us and gave fantastic service. Delicious!

vgnORsZm4KOU7gckmKxgZA.text: This Mexican food was spot on. m-1EuzT0fzIisO1Bq-Xrug.text: This is a great place. Manny is the Manager and has a great personality with excellent customer service skills and a sense of humor. The place is immaculate and the food is to die for. I am a limo driver and I try to stop at Bajamar every day for my favorite tostada, which Manny may name for me on his extensive menu. Prices are very reasonable, food is fresh and prepared with culinary expertise!! The fish taco is "out of this world" and the place is a jewel in the desert waiting to be discovered!!

9fIXpTvCVCPrGz5PiyFTUg.text: This place is legit!  Ended up here after reading other Yelp reviews.  Place is small but nice and clean. Food is amazing. Go for the Lucas Taco or the Gobernador Taco. Everyone loves the horchata and the hibiscus lemonade. Server/chef was conscientious to bring tostadas last so that the tortilla wouldn't get soggy!  Average price of about $15 per person including drink.

AJ0-hmATcqIfMh7dyHghzg.text: We had the Camaron Enchilado, and it was just as advertised, if not better. We also had  the Shrimp Tostada's and the first thing that you taste is this lemony/citrusy flavor followed by a kick if spice when biting into the shrimp. You have an option to have ayour shrimp raw or cooked. W chose to cooked, and might I say it was amazing! The horchata is homemade and taste just like arros con leche (Rice & milk), a Mexican dessert dish. All in all my experience here was great!

3qM0TcwhIe4loaGJfrQZNQ.text: Delicious  I got the Lucas taco and loved it. Very clean inside and the server was nice. Don't be afraid to get a little bit messy in here when you eat, the tacos are stuffed!

1GiLY1wSeqiU3pbFbg8K3Q.text: Really the best fish taco I've had in a long time.  Not near anything downtown or the strip, but definitely worth the Uber ride.  Very casual atmosphere with high-end cooking.  I had the Bajamar seafood taco, one grilled, one batter fried, they were both amazing.  Also had the local Las Vegas beer with a Bajamar tostado.  Would have tried for more, but I couldn't eat another bite.  Everything was F R E S H!!!  Yum!

KrnO_VLVtAIelbC7cvplDw.text: Bajamar translates for those that are not familiar with Spanish to ~  Low Tide.  Fear not as there is nothing low or substandard in this establishment from the amazing food, fantastic price point and outstanding service.  With roots from San Diego   Of the dishes I've had:  The Pulpo Enchilado: (octopus) Sauteed pulpo with chile de arbol, Monterey cheese, red cabbage and salsa fresca.  5/5 my favorite :)  Lucas Taco: Monterey cheese, grilled California pepper, sauteed shrimp and chipotle cream sauce. 4/5 *  * Flavorful unfortunately it fell apart on me after sitting for 4 minutes while I consumed the Pulpo Enchilado.    Shrimp Tostada Raw or cooked shrimp, salsa fresca, lime juice and avocado. 4.75/5  Bajamar Fish Taco Battered tilapia, salsa fresca, red cabbage and chipotle cream sauce 4.75/5  Some of the best seafood tacos/ tostadas in town.  Manny (owner)  is super personable and gives service above and beyond.  The pride he takes in his business you can see in every interaction and dish served.   I foresee many happy returns to Bajamar in my future and hopefully yours.

5LuQ0IX5KpgmO-YrPz48Pg.text: First time here and didn't let me down!  I'd heard some talk about this place from other people in my neighborhood....all good comments, if not great. 0BPUbJqoo2oRNtZ3t8hPbQ.text: I found them on uber eats the reviews were amazing and the pictures too I was so excited since I am from the Baja and Obviously I am not expecting the same flavor from there but I had my hopes . I order 2 camaron enchilados and I even specify spiciest possible well it wasn't spicy at all. NOTHING!!! The taste was meh I was looking for salt they didnt put on my order and 1 taco look poor with only 3 small shrimps. The pulpo taco was really good in taste but still was missing the spicy salsa. Personally I didnt like the marlin and gobernador taco I wont comment on those since I havent found any marlin tacos that I like here in the US. Cinnamon taste on the horchata was too much. I think they can improve on the flavors and salsas since they have a fresh "salsa" that is only tomato, cilantro and onion they should add serrano. I will be going to taste the food over there not delivered. Overall I was really excited since I was hungover I thought it was going to be awesome for that but since nothing was spicy the food didn't help and was a huge disappointing.   The delivery and packing of the food was awesome !

1qP1XVqJAJNPWtzT1AQglA.text: Found this amazing place on yelp! O.M.G.! This is an amazing hidden place! I read the other reviews, and went here with a high expectation.  The location wasn't a huge draw until I saw it is literally next door to the best frozen custard in the world.  The place is clean and the service is great.  The food is INCREDIBLE!  We were out for business, so I had some budget to spend, and this place was not expensive but was a ton for your money.

4pi-ixm7Iwty7GX1qyVjqw.text: This place was excellent. The food had such a unique and authentic feel. The flavors were unlike anything I have had before. Price is very reasonable for the amazing quality. Service was great! Manny really took care of us and made the experience a 10.

7qAz9G90i3E_Rxz7izynPw.text: Being from California, I know my fish tacos. BajaMar has really put their stamp on having the best fish tacos. Not only in Vegas, but arguably anywhere. Seriously. The fish they prepare comes out as crunchy-golden goodness, but it is really the topping-cabbage/slaw that adds another layer of deliciousness. If you thought you know you know your fish tacos like I do, give BajaMar a try. You will never be disappointed.

HOfiXg-fqha1Y2zdSWLAZQ.text: My favorite Mexican seafood place. My family and I come at least 2x a month because how much we love the food. My favorite dishes are the shrimp taco, gobernador, Lucas, ceviche and cocktail de camaron  highly recommended. The owner is super attentive, great service and it's super clean. I give it a 100 out of 10!

N1RsEg2XAvJegE5G74FuVQ.text: Clean, excellent service and their tacos are tasty, crispy. Best tacos for me in a long time.

5j-qYDogXST1mBfWpkkeRQ.text: Honestly, there is nothing negative to say about this establishment. Everything I have tried here has been amazing and the service is outstanding! The best place to eat downtown.

3jVF4-_WoyBKpADCeHe5eQ.text: FISH TACOS. Must I say more. I came in on a Tuesday. Or what the cold kids call it taco Tuesday. The fish tacos were $2.50 a dollar cheaper than on any other day. I walk in and the set up is a little strange the door is by the bar where the kitchen is and then there are tables off to the side but if you sit at the tables the waiter cannot see you so I opted for the bar. They don't sell any form of alcohol but I believe they are going to change that soon.  The menu is one sided but has a good amount of stuff mostly seafood. I got 3 fish tacos ($2.50)and 1 octopus taco ($4)and a side of rice and beans ($2 each) the food came out fast and it tasted very fresh. The fish itself was crisp and very light. The slaw was also crisp and cooling against the chipotle crema. The octopus taco was the bomb tho. It had crispy cheese and spicy octopus with the same vibrant slaw from the fish taco. Just delicious. The rice and beans were a perfect companion for the tacos. The rice was nicely seasoned and the beans were hearty and covered in cheese.  Overall a pleasant place to spend an evening and if you have a craving for seafood tacos this is the place to go.

_gWRCHN8no8buWET7Lg3hg.text: Bajamar Seafood & Tacos is located at the intersection of E Wyoming Ave (X) S Las Vegas Blvd. If you're travelling north along Las Vegas Blvd and go past the old "Olympic Gardens" (aka OG) building, you've gone too far.  The lot has two buildings serving Mexican food. Bajamar is the "blue building". The floor plan is like a small diner. The decor is like a lot of Mexican fish taco restaurants, nowadays. However, unlike other fish tacos (which have a really bland taste), Bajamar has chipotle and aioli sauces which give their food a really distinctive taste profile. It's a bold flavor--but not so spicy that it's overwhelming. And I would recommend that you eat your meal on site. The combination of seafood, cabbage, pico de gallo, and sauces create a "juicy" taco which can be a bit messy.   Bajamar does have carne asada--but most of the menu is based on seafood. During my visit, I sampled these tacos: spicy octopus; shrimp; "Gobernador"; "marlin"; and carne asada. All of the tacos that I had were very good. Here a few notes:   Octopus Taco: When overcooked, octopus becomes tough. In this case, the meat was tender.  Shrimp Taco: When ordering the shrimp taco, you have the choice of whole shrimp, grilled or battered. If you order this item, do so because you want fried shrimp. Otherwise, you might as well order the "Gobernador" Taco.  Gobernado Taco: This is a shrimp taco--grilled and minced. I prefer this to the "shrimp taco" because you're more likely to get shrimp in each bite.  Marlin Taco:  It isn't "marlin". Its smoked tuna. But the (lightly) smoked fish provides a unique taste that I haven't found outside of Florida.  Carne Asada Taco: The meat was moist and tender, but still firm enough to allow a little "chew". It also wasn't too heavily spiced or salted.   The restaurant has a nice selection of beers in bottles, and on tap; Mexican soft drinks; and blended beverages--such as horchata.  I dropped by for lunch on a Friday, and the place was full. There were tradesmen in their work gear, and people in business attire. Most were locals, but there were tourist as well. I mention this because this section of Las Vegas Blvd is outside of the tourist strip, and is a little rough. It is fine during the day, but I admit the area can feel scary a night. However, if you like fish tacos, you really should give this place a try.  (And if you have room for desert, check out "Luv-It Frozen Custard" next door.)

Li4WiSsrs1iagt7-jkXhXA.text: I'm playing catch up with my reviews and really wanted to knock this one off my list first.  Bajamar occupies the old Chinese spot by OG's and Viva las Arepas. I had always wondered who or what was going to take up residency here and I'm glad it's this place!   We came in on a random afternoon during lunch time. There's not a ton of table, but there is a very long, shiny wood bar to sit at too. The place is beautifully redone. We opted for the bar and were immediately greeted by the owner and were given menus and some ice waters. I ordered the shrimp tostada and the tostada mixta, which has shrimp, octopus and fish. My forever partner in crime ordered the fish taco special. We made small talk and found out that the owner is originally from the SD area and that there's only 3 people running the show there.   Our food arrived shortly after and I actually had the restraint to stop and take a few photos beforehand, which is a miracle because I wanted to dive right in. The tostadas were crisp underneath the giant piles of shrimp, octopus and fish. The seafood was incredibly fresh, light and super chunky! Perfect. There's hot sauce available on the table caddy, along with a paper towel roll, s & p. I didn't try the fish tacos, but they looked fantastic and were reported to be delicious as well. Nicely sized pieces of golden fried fish atop corn tortillas and a fresh slaw to finish it off.   We left super satisfied and are looking forward to our next visit in!

Tostada Mixta -- fresh, zesty, and saucy!!! Honestly the owner knows his stuff, works hard and you can taste it.  Best seafood taco spot in Vegas!

6BFcX4PGs92vMN-LNiDO3w.text: From the moment I walked in I liked the place, then I tried the food and I was in love.  There is a small parking lot right in front of Bajamar off Las Vegas Blvd. It can be a bit tight, and a few transients have been sighted, but it makes for a great show when you're having lunch or dinner. I was greeted immediately when I walked in and sat at the bar. I thought about getting food to-go, but a few regulars (yes, they already have them) enticed me to stay and dine. I'm so very glad I did.  I was walked through the menu, which is in English on one side - Spanish on the other, and wanted to try everything. The service was top-notch. Very attentive and I could tell that he sincerely wanted me to have a great experience. I went with the Bajamar Fish Taco and Lucas Taco. Pause here as I take a moment of silence for these tacos.  The Bajamar taco was fresh, battered just enough, and packed with flavor. The Lucas Taco blew my mind. The gentleman sitting next to me recommended it because he has ordered it everyday since they opened. That's commitment!! It did not disappoint. I want to make a baby with that chipotle sauce. They make their own horchata and it was amazing. I'm not an expert, but it was creamy, not too sweet. I loved it.   I took a chance and ordered the cheesecake to go. This was more of a 3-star cheesecake and wasn't decorated with fruit or any type of sauce like I was expecting based on other photos. I had one bite at home, tossed the rest. I might give it one more chance during my next trip, but only because I love cheesecake so much. It will be better for my belly if I don't like it anyway. Plus, more room for Lucas Tacos!!!

NryGYtYlg8u6MmQiG2mPeg.text: Attention: This is not just another taco shop. Tacos el Gordo is delicious, but Bajamar is not in competition with them or any other Mexican food joint. Unless I missed something on the menu, they don't serve anything but seafood. No asada. No pastor.   We tried the Lucas Taco, the Pulpo (octopus) Enchilado Taco and the horchata. The food is beautiful to look at, scratch made, and very fresh. The Lucas is basically a chile relleno in a tortilla with grilled shrimp on top. The horchata takes two days to make and is very tasty.

I usually go to this restaurant about once month to have their amazing tacos and I gotta say that it's definitely the best taco restaurant in Las Vegas. The tacos may seem a bit expensive but they are every bit worth it. They also have special deals on Monday where they have their fish taco half off which is great.   I think the best part of this restaurant is the service. Every time I come here I am always greeted by Manny who is one of the waiters. He is extremely friendly and always recognizes us when we walk through the door. If you go to Bajamar you will most likely see this guy working his butt while talking with multiple customers. One time I was eating at Bajamar when Manny noticed an single unfinished taco on my plate. Knowing that I usually finish my tacos without an issues, he asks there was any wrong. This being the first time I tried that particular taco, I told him that I didn't like that taco. Manny, being the cool guy that he is, asks me why and then offers to take that taco off of my check. He is a very cool guy. When you come to Bajamar you are guaranteed the best service!  Pulpo taco 10/10. This place is bliss!

R7IU-kQggFnY-lyqnMYDsw.text: Amazing little fish taco joint!! I ordered Lucas taco & tsunami tostada . Both had a amazing a flavors ! Fish was very fresh . Not dry at all like some fish tacos can be very bland but not the ones here !It was an explosion of fresh seasonings . The tostada had octopus that was nice and tender . I would definitely come back here again !!! An added plus is they also sell beer !!

R5UjPEwFdhHiSor-eO16fA.text: The tacos are excellent!!!!! We had one of each and they were ALL AMAZING! I also had a Horchata that I highly recommend.   Manny was so friendly! A genuine and happy man. He was on point with everything!  Constantly picking up dirty napkins plates etc! He even had our tacos come out 2 at a time so that they wouldn't get cold.   The place is brand new, extremely clean and welcoming!  Don't waste your time eating at overpriced restaurants on the strip. They have plenty of parking as well.   This is the place to eat!   Service and food was beyond AMAZING!   We plan to always come here when we are in town!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bajamar Seafood & Tacos - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bIvxRSV_N2CDKLC2YGSL5g.text: I work in the downtown area so this has become on of my favorite go-to spots.  Two reasons:  the food is delicious, and the service is quick and friendly.  Full disclosure - I'm from San Diego originally and frequented Baja when I was younger so I'm partial to good seafood tacos.  I've tried them all here but my favorites are the "Camaron Enchilado" and the "Pulpo".  Sports on the TV and draft beer on tap.   Manny is the owner, he's great!  George is on the grill and Melissa is the hostess.  They will make you feel at home.  Salud!

photos.caption: Photo of Bajamar Seafood & Tacos - Las Vegas, NV, United States

o7G1j-oUKdNTaLr7SpZW9w.text: Yep!  As advertised, great fish tacos!   Also did the octopus taco, excellent.   Come Monday or Tuesdays and the fish tacos are $1.00 off.  Definitely worth your time to try...I will be a regular!

lehsWKWU9RgKHIxjWvohog.text: My cousin took me to this place and the fish tacos are DELICIOUS. Everything tasted amazing. I had the hibiscus lemonade to drink and I loved it. Every Monday and Tuesday they have Bajamar tacos for $2.50 all day. I'll be back.

tNvM4-NAS3fZEaeK_IDi3A.text: We came to Las Vegas to get married and we were really looking forward to eating some shrimp or fish tacos. We did some research and decided to give this place a shot and let me tell you we were NOT disappointed! We tried the fish taco fried, the shrimp tacos both ways, and the Bajamar shrimp taco and they were all amazing, absolutely delicious! We wish this place was close to home and can't wait to stop in on our next trip to Vegas!

x4s0Te8mG_quh2u4UE7lpA.text: Where do I even begin! My fiance and I are always looking for new places to eat. We came across Bajamar.  And let me tell you.... we're hooked! We literally have tried all the tacos they have on their menu. Every single one of them was made with love!  We've been here twice and everything tastes fresh and just like the first time we been there.  Not only is the food amazing but the service is 120%. Manny made us feel very welcomed and went through the menu with us and gave us his recommendations. Honestly, at this point I feel like we just need to try every single thing on their menu and I'm sure we won't be disappointed.   Bajamar knows exactly what they're doing! Can't wait to see them grow because we just became regulars!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bajamar Seafood & Tacos - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bajamar Seafood & Tacos - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1R0khEIK7-VG0NDedRoR3A.text: Bajamar Seafood & Tacos serves amazing fresh seafood. In a 6 day trip we've been back twice.  The food is affordable and so delicious.  I highly recommend the Gobernador Taco, Cameron Taco, Tostado Mixta and the Mixta Soup.  Generous portions, well seasoned, soup is made from scratch while you wait.  Staff and the owner are charming and so welcoming.  Worth the Uber from the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Bajamar Seafood & Tacos - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Cx8Enq5-rtLyauRZSNQGxQ.text: When we come into town from LA, we try and eat near downtown all the time now.  The food is cheaper, better, and we are able to support the local community.  This time, we made it to Bajamar on our way back home.  We had an octopus taco, a couple of the fish tacos, and the tilapia ceviche tostada.  It was all incredible.  Not to mention the homemade lemonade there, which was spot on.    When you can have better fish tacos in Las Vegas than in LA, you're doing something right.

JCa5jx4MSCCAeJihGXmgnw.text: Great Tacos!!!!! Friendly Faces, Good Prices. Love the Pulpo de enchilada and the Fish Tacos!!!! Excellent. Great hibiscus Lemonade. All very yummy and reasonable. I will be back!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bajamar Seafood & Tacos - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bajamar Seafood & Tacos - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Taco Love!

CRVQevg80zJdj9c0xOz-PA.text: Such a delicious mom & pop shop with UNREAL tostadas y tacos. Coming from Texas, I was nervous to try tacos in Nevada, but I was pleasantly surprised. The flavors were fabulous, the service was phenomenal, and the horchata tasted just like home.

yDZ8a_Ehgeng8ka5sdswyQ.text: I went because of all the reviews after I did a quick search on tacos in Las Vegas. Don't get me wrong, the food was good, but these aren't the cheap $1-2 tacos that people are saying. It costed $3.50 for a regular fish taco and increased in price from there. There wasn't any gorditas or any other foods that the reviews mentioned. I ended up getting the fish taco and shrimp taco. Both were really good, but it worth the price. Also they charge for water...  Overall, the food was good, but I felt tricked by all the reviews on prices and food availability.

photos.caption: Photo of Bajamar Seafood & Tacos - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bajamar Seafood & Tacos - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kuHOBLvo_cl4xRW2g56faQ.text: This place is amazing! The restaurant is clean including the bathrooms. The tacos were amazing. We had shrimp ceviche, shrimp tacos and of course fish tacos. All were fantastic! The owner is super friendly and accommodating. If you're looking for that hole in the wall "locals" place for some really good and very fairly priced food, this is a great spot!

b1Bli-9CjxltfdmvMaBJ7Q.text: Wow Im a local and this place is really good, always had pass by and I'm surprised myself I never came. Definitely a place to check out if you like seafood. The Jamaica drink is really good has a good flavor to it. I got a shrimp tacos and fish taco the sauce completes everything.

bRGmWxI459t58p6vTBuuKw.text: Awesome customer service, easy parking... Manny was super helpful and patient with suggestions and recommendations.... came for the fish tacos.. I'll be back for the octopus and shrimp.

photos.caption: Photo of Bajamar Seafood & Tacos - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Bajamar Seafood & Tacos - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu...

_r5936LLl37Yy3aINOiTTQ.text: This place was AMAZING!! Got the Bajamar taco and Camaron Enchilado but got the shrimp battered  instead. Seriously the best fish tacos I've ever had! Lived in Vegas most of my life and from California originally, so finding a place that can make tacos like back home is impossible. But this place does it! So fresh, place is clean, it's a hole in the wall (that's where all the best tacos come from) and the owner was so friendly and turns out he's from the same area in California as me! They'll pretty do whatever they can to modify and make you happy and it's delicious. I was worried that by the time I got home it wouldn't be as good but after sitting in my car for an hour during traffic and reheating for a few seconds, seriously so amazing!! Thank you for existing!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bajamar Seafood & Tacos - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Camaron Enchilado Tacos with battered shrimp.

8YYuln992Y668-U0naVF1Q.text: This place has been open for a few months. Tried it out with my favorite person to try new places and most of the menu. lol.  We had the Aguachile  Rojo  Shrimp marinated in lime juice, beets, habanero chile and jicama.  This was amazing an fresh!  Great to have on a hot summer day. It was a bit spicy, but oh so good.  Next we had the Chicharron de Pulpo - I would say don't bother ordering this.  Next we had Camaron Enchilado Taco- Sauteed shrimp with chile de arbol, Monterey cheese, red cabbage and salsa fresca. These were very good and a must when eating here. Also has the Pulpo Enchilado  which were good, but the pulpo  was not as great.  The Marlin Taco was good, but again nothing out of this world  and the Lucas taco has potential as the grilled California pepper added some good texture and flavor but it need a little more flavor. All in all this place is good and worth checking out.  They don't serve beer as of now or any other alcohol.

cojMhmf6Ll6Dy3EHGmqszg.text: I am a big taco fan. Belive me this place is absolutely fantastic. It was Bestttttt tacossss that i have ever ever ever hadd!!!! Loved it!

Oh8_UXQ4VA_n6yWid05T1g.text: Delicious food, very nice persons!  Helps us during ordering! I really liked the tacos!  Took the Deuchs bus there, stop just next to the restaurant ( other side of the traffic light)  Would definitely go there again!  Nice shop, great food

O83MJ9M7Mk_V0qTQ2R_OPg.text: Wow, best fish tacos I've had in Vegas. Besides going to San Diego or Mexico, good fish tacos are hard to find. This place does not disappoint.   This spot used to be a bizarre Chinese food/donuts place. I know, weird. So when I saw this was being remodeled, I was hoping it would turn into something decent. I was wary to try at first, but after some friends recommended I had to try. I'm glad I did. I didn't try a thing that I didn't like. And the hibiscus lemonade is delicious. I'll be sure to try the horchata next time.   The decor in here is nice. The spot is small but packs a mighty punch. This needs to be in your taco rotation. And the prices are excellent. Don't be afraid of the parking lot, eat the tacos!

eGmIUrrKrLMk5ohb37H55Q.text: Hands down the best fish tacos in Vegas. The reviews are True so I don't have anything else to say other than to give it a try!

m7HHLMYFOnPoP_5lbtWbcw.text: Unbelievable food and service! Everything about this place is perfect. I had the Lucas taco and the octopus taco. They didn't skimp on ingredients or flavor. Everything is made fresh and to order and you can tell the difference.  Try the hibiscus lemonade. It was so refreshing!

faGyFg1E1Bt7gmJ56qRZAA.text: Having resided in San Diego for many years I have a high standard for fish tacos.  So I entered Bajamar expecting disappointment.  Instead I was pleasantly surprised.  Designed as if it was a beach bar restaurant Manny, the owner who has from Chula Vista takes pride in his product.  Limited to fish tacos, tostada's, and seafood entrees, Bajamar distinguishes itself from other local establishments with fresh, well prepared fish and ingredients.   I have been there twice and will work this into my lunch routine. The tacos are reasonably priced between 4-6 dollars each and two will fill most people up.

photos.caption: Photo of Bajamar Seafood & Tacos - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4LXdc0ETG1YYdft8kClwHQ.text: Yup - fantastic. I was the only customer in the place around 8pm during SEMA. The tacos were simply to die for. And of course super fresh. Loved it!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bajamar Seafood & Tacos - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NYz3f6X_2embNOyJVapcYg.text: Wow, this place is amazing! The food is so good! I got the Tostada Mixta. The best I have ever had by far. The Bajamar fish taco is so delicious. The people are so friendly. Everything is so clean. Highly highly recommended this place. I will come back here again when I come back to Vegas!

3P1BTeRI-qOVJ0zWhc6lvw.text: Manny and his crew are super friendly and accommodating.  My boys and I were visiting from CA this past weekend and we ran across this place and decided to try.  We asked Manny what was the best menu item and he recommended the Pulpo or Octopus.  We didn't go for it and ordered everything from shrimp to carne asada.  We also ordered a few appetizers and were pleasantly surprised.  When the rest of our tacos came we quickly devoured them and they were fresh, crisp and delicious.  We then knew if the rest of the tacos were that good, we should try the octopus.  4 of us ordered the octopus and they were so good.  The octopus was tender and the accompanying sauce and trimmings just melt in your mouth.  These are the best seafood tacos in Vegas.  We ended up eating here everyday of our trip and making good friends with Manny and his crew.

gTOdN0vbgtkDMDTn9QF2ag.text: This was a diamond in the rough! After a lovely celebration at the Graceland Chapel where we celebrated renewal of our friends vows we toasted with amazing micheldas, fresh guacamole and mouthwatering tacos. If you haven't stopped by it's a must. Not a ton of seating, but wait staff is attentive, has great customer service and is kid friendly. We even tried to go two days in a row but weren't able to get a seat in time with our travel plans!

7JUZHGXuy2X67ojBD5CCTQ.text: Off the strip, plenty of parking. Walked in and order. And it was delicious and fresh! Will be coming back soon! Tacos del Gobernador tacos de pescadotacos de camaron  And the aguas frescas hibiscus lemonade was amazing! Overall customer service was excellent!

gPgAqZl6_8ScbFMwFHjNUw.text: Fish tacos are PERFECTION! Best fish tacos I have ever had. All of the ingredients are fresh and the fish, although battered, is not super oily.   The octopus tacos were delicious as well. The sauce they marinade them in is really tasty, however it does make the tortillas a little messy and soggy.   Marlin tacos (a la brasa) were our least favorite. They cook it in a tomato sauce that was just a little overwhelming. Not terrible, but not great either.

vGpmzR1fed1FiRSULXea1w.text: Wonder meal. They do a great job. I felt like I was at home having dinner with friends.Manny took great care of us. We tried about 5 different things and they were all Great. Totally recommend.

K0Gk5xsyxNq10s_AoBldog.text: Well done. Good people doing their best to provide food that they passionate about. Fresh all from scratch preparations. Among the best tacos in town.

iZvPumyucbMVC9EJKbl70g.text: This has to be the top restaurant in Las Vegas, hands down. The food here is so fresh and so tasty, and SO CHEAP! The fish and shrimp were absolutely world class, on par with 5 star resorts my wife and I have to in Cancun. Amazing service. Will come again.

sXOzk736pAx9PwAWtZboXQ.text: Very good food. Clean and fast service. Came here on a Saturday night from California.  I would recommend this place for people who want some authentic fresh sea food.
